Horrible... took forever to explain the easiest concepts and breezed through in depth material that ended up being the heart of the finals and midterms. Take the night course with another teacher.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Not helpful at all,talks down to students,barely curves,moves way too quickly through complex material,and her review sheet for the final pretty much had nothing to do with the actual test. Absolute worst teacher I have had in my 14 years of education.
midterm and final were tough, material not exactly covered in book, she tests you on how the formulas work and not how to use them.
She was probably the least organized, knowledgable prof. I have ever had. She couldn't even do her own review sheets.  AVOID, AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!!!!!

For a moderate hard class like this, she is a horrible professor. She doesn't have patience and her attitude is apparent when students don't follow her pace and style as she did at the review session. She is teaching this class next quarter. Take the block session even though it is longer.

This lady was a joke....She took over the department and she turned it into an impossible class...I went to her review session and she confused me even more...This proves once again that Ohio State needs to take poor teacher like her out of this university...
The worst teacher I have ever had. She gets pissed with her student when they do not understand something instead of trying to walk them through it. She thinks she knows everything.

Horrible teacher! doesnt explain her examples, goes way too fast, teaches material that isnt in the book, and gets angry when students dont attend her 8am lecture. for the final review, everybody was yelling at her for her crappy teaching style, and everybody clapped when the TA took over the review
I can't say she was terrible.... but she definately was NOT GOOD!  She doesn't want to take the time to be a professor...  just wants to teach and get out of there

HORRIBLE!! Her reviews have absolutely nothing to do with the quizzes, which have almost no relation to the textbook.  She goes way too fast and gets far ahead of the syllabus for no reason.  She does not answer questions well, and flat out is a terrible teacher.  Avoid at all costs!!

Easy course but not the easiest teacher to understand. I stayed in bed and taught myself better than she taught the class. She was the author or the book "statistics for dummies". Suggestion to her, read the book "teaching for dummies".
Good teacher, not always so clear because she goes kind of fast.  The TA was more helpful.
Really tries to help you out, occasionally goes too slowly.  Great powerpoint slides and course packets.  Really friendly and good professor, all in all.

summary_comment: Dr. Marques is consistently criticized for her strict grading policies and difficult exams, which often do not align with the material covered in lectures. Students find her lectures slow and unhelpful, and many advise against taking her class, citing issues with her voice clarity, lack of support materials, and unfair grading practices.

Ratings.comment: Grade hard on homework and exams. She will give you points off for not having a fully hand-written cheat sheet during exams.

If I had to guess, the issue is that since Marques is new, she got handed lecture materials, but those are very easy and intended for very easy exams.  Then, Marques gave hard exams which made people struggle.  Lectures were also kinda slow - I learned everything on my own.  My guess is that the grades are skewed left if you know what I mean ;)

Dr. Marques was genuinely terrible. On the second exam, I got 0/12 points on multiple questions even if I showed work. I've never had a professor not give partial credit. During lecture, she speaks so quietly that the people who sit in the front row can't hear her. I advise anyone who has to take Stat 3301 to take it with a different professor.

The exams were harder than what she'd taught, and her grading on projects was strict. Her writing was hard to read, and her voice was small. No recording was provided, making it harder to review after class. No curves for midterms, even though she noticed lots of students complaining about some unclear questions on the midterm.

I do not recommend her class because she doesn't care about students, plus she does not want students to succeed in her class. Even her voice is so small that I cannot recognize what she said. For this semester, her lectures have not helped me prepare for exams and projects. I had to study by myself to survive in this class.

There was only one practice exam and it was not helpful at all as the actual questions she gave on the exam bore no resemblance to the practice exam. She is also very strict about grading exams and projects, making it impossible to get a high grade in this class. Would recommend taking another professor's class instead of hers.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which helps students learn effectively despite occasional pacing issues. His exams closely mirror practice materials and homework, and he allows cheat sheets, making it easier for students to succeed. However, some find his lectures can be fast-paced and require focused attention, and the final exam average is often lower than desired.

Ratings.comment: Great professor! Hilarious and always willing to help. He is a bit jumpy in lectures but he deserves the high ratings.

Andrew might not be a perfect fit for everyone, but I got value from his lectures and learned the content well. Kind of gives ADHD energy, which worked well for me but not for others. Exams are exactly like the practice ones he posts, AND he allows you to make a formula sheet. Was able to ace both of the midterms and didn't need the final to pass.

Cool guy with really helpful lectures. Exams (2 mt + final) are straightforward and the same as homework/lecture material. A cheat sheet is allowed on exams. The class is fast paced, especially the middle portion, but the content is easy. The final exam average was a D though so studying might be needed.

Pretty easy and lenient grader, you are allowed a cheat sheet on every test and complete open notes on online quizzes. Lectures can be kind of boring but that is because the content is extremely boring at times but if you pay attention, he is a great lecturer. He is a nice guy, rounded my grade from an A- to an A without me even asking.

He is cool dude and not that bad of a teacher but really struggled with anything that involved social skills. Class was pretty hard and that was not helped by him not providing any help but still not impossible. Avg on final was like a 67% so I would not say he had people really prepared well but also his exams are not similar to review.
Cool dude. Very engaged with the material. Would recommend going to lecture although its not required.
Nice and gives good, helpful lectures. Exams are also very reasonable in content but have a low B median. Homework and quizzes are easy and are meant to bring up your grade.
He is very kind and tries to make his lectures fun with his stats jokes. Quizzes and homework were all online. First midterm was confusing, second was easy.

I will try to seperate my hatred for this class that is mandatory for my major from my review of the professor.

Andrew was a overall good professor, who is kind and does understand his content. I hate statistics, but Andrew did a fine job of explaining the material. Homework is light, exams are fair, quizes are a free 100%.

I took this class in person during Spring 2024 with Prof Duda and ended up doing really bad as the lectures were not clear and it was difficult to read her writing but after retaking it over the summer with Prof Heeszel I was able to actually learn the material and ended up doing pretty well on the exams. He and his TAs respond fast to questions.

summary_comment: This professor excels in delivering highly interactive and well-explained lectures, addressing doubts enthusiastically. He is widely regarded as the best professor due to his clarity and extensive use of examples to aid understanding. Additionally, he offers prompt and helpful feedback beyond regular class hours.

Ratings.comment: Very interactive lectures. Concepts are explained very well. He also addresses doubts and questions with great enthusiasm.

He is the best professor I've ever had. He is very clear and provides a lot of examples to help you get familiar with the formula. Besides, outside the class, he is helpful. Sometimes, I could get his feedback email after 8 pm.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his commitment to their success. Students find him funny and caring, though his lectures can be somewhat dry and his handwriting challenging to follow. Despite these minor drawbacks, many recommend taking his classes due to his thorough explanations and fair assessments.

Ratings.comment: Had him for both 3202 and 3301. Such a great professor. Always willing to meet with me if I needed any help on assignments. Also really funny and just a nice professor overall. Take him for sure!!

Nice and funny guy. Uses real world examples to help teach about regression, which I found super useful. Lectures were kind of dry, but he did his best. As for assignments, weekly HWs can take a couple hours, so don't do them last second. Exams mimic the practice exam, but imo he can grade kind of harsh. Would take again, and highly recommend.

Funny guy. Easy exams (practice exam strongly resembles actual exams most of the time). Will always give you adequate time to complete homeworks, very forgiving on extensions and makeups. However, sometimes very disorganized and doesn't communicate deadlines well. Also, agree with others, you have to listen to lectures, bc his handwriting is bad.

Aknowledges that his handwriting is terrible, proceeds to make most of his lectures based on his handwriting. Baffling he doesn't take the step to type out what he wants to communicate. Base level class is hard, made even harder by interpreting notes
Awesome professor who really cares a lot about his students! His lectures are a little dry and he takes a while to grade. However, he wants his students to succeed and listens to student feedback.

Professor Steephanson's class is really good! His lectures can be kind of mid, but the exams are similar to the homework so if you study those then you will be alright.  The exams are realistic and I felt like I learned a lot.  Definitely a good professor to have for this class!

An extremely nice and caring professor who wants you to succeed and understands what it's like to be a student. His lectures are pretty dry, but he is more than willing to clarify and answer any questions you have. I cannot emphasize enough how much he cares about you as a student, truly a great professor and a great person.

I took him for stat 3202 and 3301. Lectures are still not great. But some of his 3301 lectures were clear and simple, so he is improving or teaches stat 3301 better. Also, I think he should teach office hours stuff at his lectures, since I learned a lot from office hours and by asking questions. HW and exams were fair. He knows a lot about stats!

Very accessible and willing to help students. Lectures were dry but I think it was the material, every so often he would throw in a story which helped a bit. Lots of pop quizzes but manageable if you are semi-conscious during lecture. Homework very managable.

His lectures are awesome and super descriptive. He refers back to previous lecture material often so you can understand the concepts he is building upon from for the new material. Homeworks and exams are very reasonable. Great professor overall.

He is definitely caring, and he was willing to curve when the class average was poor. About halfway through the semester, he started annoyed that others were not attending the in-person lecture, so he started doing pop quizzes in class, which seemed counterproductive. could be worse but the class is somewhat difficult anyways

Steephanson is funny and fair. Yes the midterms and final were hard, but it was defintely fair. HOWEVER, the lectures are usually not clear. Many lectures are more complicated than it should be. Lectures about stats got to be simplified as possible so we can understand clearly. He can be one of the best teachers if the lectures are not confusing.

He's funny and caring. Boring lectures but I don't think it was his fault, it was just the material. He does explain the material well and is good at being accessible and helpful during office hours. Like others have mentioned, his handwriting sucks, although he does admit it, and is more than willing to explain further to help you understand.
He is ok. Wants students to understand and is very lenient with homework deadlines. Class is very fair. A bit hard to understand in lecture though because of his handwriting.

Very caring and understanding. Attendance is not mandatory, but there are pop quizzes that are very easy if you solve them in person during the lecture. Exams are super manageable if you do the practice exams he posts on Carmen.

mid, lectures are just alright, I wouldn't mind taking class with him again except his accent makes it a bit harder for me to understand everything he says so that's the major downside. But other than that he's helpful and humourous, his jokes were somehow so funny I couldn't stop laughing, and exams are fair and pretty lightly weighted as well

summary_comment: Draper is widely regarded as an exceptional professor, known for his engaging and enjoyable teaching style, though his classes are challenging and require significant effort. Students appreciate his enthusiasm and commitment to helping them succeed, despite the demanding workload and high expectations. While the class is noted for its difficulty, many find Draper's positive demeanor and genuine care for his students to be a significant asset.

Ratings.comment: Draper is just a great guy, no one is a better professor. What a great guy, man oh man, he is such a great teacher.

Difficult class but Draper is a goat. He made a march madness bracket for our class and will always add comments about sports throughout lecture. Attendance and participation is required, you have to answer live questions on Pearson during lecture.

Draper is the best teacher by far for this class. Had him last semester for both lecture and recitation and he seemed like he always wanted the best for his students. He has said the gripes he had with the course but he does not make it. The material is also a bit overrated. It is not hard however having good group case groups matter.

Draper is a good professor and a really likeable guy but I think he forgets that his students don't know as much as him. He is one of the smartest professors I have met but his expectations are really high.  During the first week of the sports analytics class he said the class would be fun. I had anything but fun. Good guy tho

If you have to take this class, Draper is as good as it gets. As for the actual class, it's probably the hardest class I have taken. The group cases take forever, especially if you get terrible groups that don't want to help. The exams are multiple choice, but still hard. I highly recommend doing the extra credit. Those points saved my grade.

Draper himself is fine, it's just the class that's awful. If you took 1430 the prior semester, it's not as bad since it just builds off, but there is SO MUCH WORK. It should've been 4 credits like 1430 was, I did more than twice as much work for this class. The TAs grade group projects super harshly and the pre-lecture quizzes are very annoying.

Draper is an amazing professor but this class is horrible. I had a D- until all of the extra credit was added and took the final. I knew people in this class who genuinely guessed on every question for the midterm and the final exam, that should say something about the difficulty of this course. Also, this course in HORRIBLE for transfer students.

Draper seems like a really nice person, but this class is super difficult. TA's grade group projects harshly and the pre lecture quizzes are super irritating because you are tested on material before going to the lecture to learn it. Do all the homework (its extra credit) because that is your savior to pass this class.

I was expecting a great professor, but he is over rates. He has tons of extra credit and curving, but the way he teaches is not it. You need to know how to do the math by hand using formulas or calculator, but he teaches using statcrunch which we cant use on tests. Nice guy, overrated, makes the class easy to pass however.

Professor Draper was amazing. I had him for Sports Analytics in the Specialized Master's in Business Analytics program. He cares a great amount for his students and is willing to meet outside of class to help. He is firm on dates but lenient if you communicate to him. Great professor!

Dr. Draper was a great professor. I honestly did not find this class that difficult. Go to office hours for group projects and you'll get an A. The exams were not overly difficult as long as you studied in Pearson. If you do all the extra credit there is no way you can fail. Dr. Draper does a great job of making people understand the material.

This class is not enjoyable but take Draper because he explains the material very well. Lecture slides and pre-lecture videos are confusing and in general, the course isn't laid out very well. Do all the extra credit and study the LC problems to prep for the exams. Go to his office hours, he is very helpful and caring.

Draper is a good guy and definitely take him for stats 2320. He's the better of the 3 professors who teach it. But I will say, the lecture prep quizzes are incredibly irritating. How do you expect students to take (and do well on) a quiz when they haven't even learned the material? Super annoying and frustrating.
Best professor for business stats. Always super helpful and an overall great guy. Learned so much from him.

Overall, 2320 is not an enjoyable class. There is no getting around the course. Dr. Draper is probably the best there is in terms of taking course. He will at least keep you awake (unlike Bonnie) and talk about sport stat problems in lecture. Be aware for exam 1, averages are always down. Lots of extra credit given, take advantage!

Best professor for 2320 (class is exactly the same though). Makes dry material somewhat bearable. Very approachable and down to earth. Plenty of extra credit so be sure to take advantage of it. Exams are not easy but doable. Cases are a little tough so start them early. Overall, the class is not as bad as a lot of people claim.

Dr. Draper is a good lecturer, but preparing for lectures is a must. The material felt disorganized. 1st test can be hard, but the later ones are doable. Studying by myself, going to office hours & TA room for specific questions were keys to my success. Do all Learning Catalytics Q's before tests. Also, do ALL extra credit b/c that is your savior.

He's a great professor and actually cares about his students. Doesn't like it if you leave class early, but that's only because you get extra credit for attending lecture. Lots of extra credit for the class, make sure you do it! Exams are reasonable and he is a great lecturer. Highly recommend!

Draper is a good guy and will go out of his way to help if you have questions. IMO the best lecturer for this class. I couldn't stand the case studies in this class cause they are graded so arbitrarily and count for a ton. Midterms are pretty straight forward if you go to lecture.

Class is not hard. It's a repeat of 1430 just with a business spin to it. 60ish% of the grade is test. The rest are recitation and cases. The cases are graded hard and can bring down your grade. About 3-4% of extra credit in hw. Test are built with 20% curves. He is the better teacher to take 2320 with.

John Draper thinks very highly of himself. He offers basically no help to students especially when it comes to questions about grades. The TA's do everything and there is a large span between the way that the TA's grade. Some are easy, others are extremely hard graders. Would not recommend him or this class

Draper is very good at what he does.  I would say that this class has way more info that a student can handle during a semester, given other difficult classes.  My suggestion would be take this class and try to pair it will less-demanding classes and you will be great! DO THE WORK! GO TO CLASS! and ENGAGE! and then your grade will speak for itself!

Professor Draper is great! He clearly explains things and is a genuinely good person. Although this class isn't the easiest, it is more the fact that the material is hard anyway. I would take him again!

Great professor, very willing to help students out after class.  Usually ends class early, and definitely one of the best core business professors at Fisher.  Also large amount of extra credit throughout course, which is needed due to relatively tough grading.

The extra credits provided saved my grade! make sure you take the time every week to do them. This was the hardest class I have ever taken, and I was a straight A student before this. Maybe I'm just bad at stats but I felt that the tests were too comprehensive while we focused a lot on problem solving during class and while doing the hw
This is a difficult class but he is a great professor!

Basically three ways to learn 2320: Lecture, Recitation, and Videos. I found the videos to be the most helpful but many found the other methods to be more helpful. Great teacher and always very personable and clear.

Dr. Draper really knows how to breakdown the material. As long as you go to lecture and do the practice problems, you will do great. Don't buy the textbook, you don't need it. Consider buying StatTools if you have Windows so that you are free to do assignments on your laptop as opposed to the computer lab in Mason.

Overall one of the tougher core classes. You will have to study for the exams quite a bit. But really not that hard to get a good grade if you put the work in. Do the extra practice problems and recitations a lot before quizzes and exams and you will do fine.

Love him very much after comparing with the boring video of Bonnie! He is very useful and willing to help you. If you fail the first exam, don't worry and you will have many chances to improve the scores because each midterm has 20 extra credit and final has 50.  Just got 280250 in the final exam and get A.
He is really good teacher. He is humorous and nice to answer your question. Watch the video is necessary.

Draper's lectures were actually really helpful, but it sucked that they were at 8am. The class uses the 'reverse classroom model,' which I'm not a huge fan of. However, he was always willing to answer questions. The midterms and final are common across both teachers and were generally pretty difficult.

Dr. Draper is a good instructor. He followed the book and sometimes mentioned his discontent about "Bayesian flavor" in the book :) He taught us fundamentals of statistics including probability, pdfs, distributions, hypothesis testing very nicely. He has a golden heart in grading. Even his exams are teaching.

John is very clear in presenting material during lecture and is willing to help. However, the tests are created by all of the professors together, so it doesn't really matter who you take for this class because all of the tests are the same. The tests are pretty hard too. Take John over Bonnie though if you can
The class sucks! He is a really good teacher though.
AWESOME
I just totally love John, he's such a good teacher!  I wish that I could have him for ALL my statistics classes, what a cutie!  Make sure you take him ladies, he's a really great guy :)

He is probably the best teacher I have had yet. He explains stuff extremely well and makes sure you understand ALL of the difficult things you are to be tested on. Makes rec. a joke, but its a required part of the grade.
This guy knows how to teach.  Very good teacher.
Projects his voice very well, explains things very well. A VERY good teacher. Much better than the day lecturer/cource cordinatior who just sort of sits and reads stuff. Interested in his job
take this guy
Excellent teacher.  Makes the material super easy to understand!  Works with you and helps you prepare for the tests accordingly.

Attendence is required because there are numerous scored individual and group activities, which are a large portion of the grade. This is not fair sometimes because you get quized immediately after seeing the material. Excellent teacher though. Material is not easy. This is my third stats class and it's every bit as hard as the previous ones.
Very easy
much better than the day lecturer so if you have to take this class take it with him.

He is a great professor and explains things better and is nicer than the day lecturer. Take his night class if you can. The other nice thing about his class is you don't have to go to recitation. As long as you don't skip class you can get a good grade without reading the book or doing much work.
Excellent teacher. He wants to do anything he can to help you. He is the night lecturer for Stat so definitely take that section if you can.
Take him.  Hes a good teacher, wants you to do well, and doesnt make the class boring.
John is by far the best teacher I have ever had! He really cares about his students and wants everyone to do well.
John is everything you want a professor to be and more. He's a great guy and makes the material very clear. If you do the homeworks, the midterms will be easy.  Take Stats from John, he's the man!
This guy is an excellent teacher. It was his first tiem teaching this course and it was very well organized. If you have to take stats, take it from this guy!!!

summary_comment: The professor is generally seen as knowledgeable but struggles with effective teaching methods, often delivering lectures that are disorganized and difficult to follow, which makes it challenging to prepare for homework and exams. Students find his office hours unhelpful and unpleasant, and some report a negative attitude from him towards both the subject and students. Overall, while he does cover the material adequately, his approach is largely criticized for being ineffective and demotivating.

Ratings.comment: His lecture is meaningless because he actually just reading the powerpoint. For the homework, he usually give student homework after he finished whole chapter and since to that time, it is hard to remember the previous knowledge. And the worst thing is his office-hour, suffering and painful. Dont take his clasee
Lectures are chaotic and unclear and don't prepare you for homework
Overall a good professor. Not that accessible outside of class and sometimes doesn't seem to care about students. However, he teaches the material in a clear way and has a good sense of humor.
solid teacher but a little mean honestly, exams weren't too hard and he prepared you pretty well for it

Horrible attitude. I once emailed him about a problem I had and he replied very passive aggressively. He knows his stuff and tries to joke around, but it's obvious he doesn't enjoy teaching and seems to have a distaste for his students. The class itself wasn't too difficult, but I would take it with a different professor if you can.
This guy has quite the attitude on him. Extremely inappropriate for the environment he works in.

Lecture goes very fast and he spends time explaining things that don't even matter or come up in homework or exams. Very unsympathetic and not accommodating for students. Going to office hours was scary because he made you feel stupid for not understanding the material. The lab for this class was pointless because TA didn't know what he was doing.
He is a horrible lecturer. I am saddened that my tuition goes to pay this guy.

Even basic statistics concepts will seem like a nightmare with him. Many did not do very well due to his poor teaching and yet he still refuses to curve the course (but instead made lab attendance required which was taught by a clueless TA). Completely unsympathetic and is very childish in his behavior. Avoid at all costs!

Genuinely terrible, does not explain concepts and whatever he talks about in lecture does not show up in the homework or exams. If you like a professor that doesn't know how to teach, this guy is for you.

He is so bad at explaining concepts that even material I knew well from my physics and math courses seemed confusing when he explained it. Noone wanted to attend his lectures so he made lab attendance mandatory which was taught by an incompetent TA. Avoid if possible or just read the textbook if you can't and you will do fine.

Richard is nice, but his teaching is average, mostly covering the slides. The course itself is very difficult,but he struggles to explain difficult concepts clearly, and exams aren't straightforward. Many students skipped class, preferring to self-study, so he made attendance mandatory. I suggest using extra resources or avoiding his class.

This course was difficult, but Dr. Richards does his best to make it less stressful. He's very willing to help and explain in office hours if you need extra help. Homeworks could get quite difficult at times, but a lot of the material in class lecture helps with it. He's also extremely funny and has a good sense of humor. I'd recommend.

Not a terrible class difficulty-wise but the exams make the class worse than it should be. They are not an accurate reflection of the class material and are worth way too much of your grade. I would not want to take this class again.

Homework can be rough sometimes but the lectures help with them for the most part. Practice exams are usually a great tool to prepare for the midterms, but I found the practice final was nothing like the actual final. Overall he's solid but far from easy.

Homework is the hardest thing here, exams were very reasonable and nothing you haven't learned in class-100% study exam reviews/practices! Prof goes quite fast in class, but if you have a good math(calculus) background you should be able to do fine. Book can be helpful, mainly try to understand the notes from lecture. It does get better later on.

He is good at teaching. Office hours helped me a lot for the most part. For stat 3410 we got to use our notes and homework in our exams which helped a lot during exams. However, I do understand the negative ratings. His class was extremely stressful at time and the exams had time pressure. He gives off pressurzing vibes, I wish he was more graceful

Dr. Richards gives you everything you need to succeed in the course as well as being accessible and helpful outside of class for extra help. Everything in the class is graded very fairly and his other experiences that he uses as examples make the class more interesting. Also he's kinda funny, intentionally or not. Too much hate for him on here imo

Lectures were very confusing, but he explained concepts very clearly in office hours. Homework wasn't too bad, but it was difficult not to get at least a few deductions every time. The exams were extremely fair.

Richards was ok. He's a good communicator and consistent in his grading. The first couple homeworks, and HW7 felt pretty relevant to lectures and very manageable, but around the middle of the semester it felt very difficult and a little unfocused. Bayesian stats isn't my strong suite and it felt very manageable- just go to lecture and ask for help
Slides and lectures almost never matched the homework given, very difficult to apply the material. Not very open to questions that seem simple to him.

Flies through lectures lacking elaboration. Teaches like we already know the material. Not enough examples to grasp concepts. This made exam prep confusing. Allowed 1 sheet of notes for exams which was helpful. Treated me like I was an inconvenience. Passionate about Stats but not teaching. My advice: Correct exam errors, visit with TA

Most unprofessional professor I've had. He does not care about students and their learning needs. He can't explain a single topic and always rushes through the lectures. I feel extreme sadness in his class and any time I think about it. Extreme. Sadness.
He is very great and helpful. Follow his lecture and you would get a good grade.

Andrew Richards is so great! He was very helpful. If I have any questions, he will arrange a zoom meeting to explain. He will also give a lot of opportunities to improve students' grades, such as midterm exams, there are opportunities for make-up exams.

The professor really doesn't care the students. There is no relationship between his sample exam and real exam. He puts two exams together in two consecutive lecture days and claims it will increase the sample space and it will help you know your position in the class. It is ridiculous. The exam is really tough. Get away from it.

Nice enough guy, brutal sense of humor, and lectures are tough to get through. He knows his stuff and he's passionate, but even the most simple concepts are convoluted beyond belief. His tests are fair, and lectures are pretty good test prep, so I'm (reluctantly) taking a class with him again.

Prof Richards gets too way much hate on here. I enjoy his lectures as I find him engaging and explains concepts well without using advanced terminology. He treats the lectures like a conversation and has interesting stories from experience. Tests can be difficult but I find his review days help you prepare well and he does his best to help you.
Sort of tough lectures, exams range from super easy to real hard. Good curve though so it evens out. Could be better at lecturing.

The knowledge is not very easy to understand actually, but in his lecture, you can never understand that. Also, you have four exams in a semester, and the final exam including all of the things you have learned before, and he is really a tough grader. His class is so boring that I feel like I am in jail during his lecture time.

very smart, but an abysmal teacher. incapable of explaining ideas from the bottom-up to people that have never seen the material. skims through ideas without explaining them; passes through lectures as if the material is completely intuitive. this is an already challenging course made impossible with such a horrific teacher. avoid avoid avoid
He always makes concepts more difficult

He is smart, but he just doesn't have the ability to bring knowledge down to a human level. Teaching students as if he is talking to his collogues, so you know he is never able to explain things is a clear way. Act like students have learn this before and just fly through materials.
Extremely monotone. His lecture is very dry and oftentimes confusing. I would not recommend him at all no matter what classes you are planning to take. Avoid him if you can

Easily one of the worst profs Ive ever had. Dont get me wrong hes super smart and passionate but incapable of bringing topics down to human levels of understanding. And when you try to get him to explain he just looks at you like an youre an idiot. Lectures were not helpful at all.
If you want to know how to make easy things obscure, take his course, take it twice!

He actually didn't know how to explain anything. He would just put stuff up and not understand when we didn't understand. I went to his office hours and leave even more confused. The exams were fair, and I ended up doing fine in the class, but it was not because of him. Every lecture left me more confused. I learned it on my own with other students
Pretty standard. Put in the work and get a good grade. Grading is a little hard on tests, but did curve the overall grade a few points.

Tests make up 70% of grade, but are fair and he tells you what will be on them (and gives practice probs). Lectures are amazing, clearly explain the process. Textbook only used for hw problems, so have a friend send them (don't buy it). 10 HW sheets, 5 quizzes (to make 20% of grade). Recitation mandatory (but very helpful). But DON'T FALL BEHIND.

summary_comment: Dr. K is described as a friendly and adaptable professor who provides clear explanations and valuable in-class questions, although her lectures can be disorganized and her exams are challenging. Students find her supportive during group cases and office hours, which helps improve their overall experience. However, the course material and exams are generally considered difficult, and some students find the lecture videos and homework outdated.

Ratings.comment: This class is hard no matter what, but I'm glad I had Dr. K. She is a little all over the place, but I think that it is just because running a zoom of like 200 kids is a lot. My biggest problem was with the TA that was with her, not good. The exams and group cases are horrible. This class just sucks but I think Dr. K is the best person to have.

Nice person, Terrible professor. No “why's” are explained in class for any of the material, she just reads off slides and doesn't explain. Tests are worded horribly and don't give any information to help you. Do yourself a favor and learn the material on khan academy even though you are paying thousands for it to be taught here.

She was genuinely the worst professor that I have ever had. She just talked to the students at the front of class for half the lecture and then would act like it was crazy that we did not know stuff. Also, if someone tells you the group cases were easy, they just didn't do anything. This class was a huge waste of my time.

Dr. K is super friendly, funny, and adaptable: thanks for writing on the smartboard rather than reading off the slides! She does a great job explaining the nuances in the content and the in-class questions. I never watched the pre-lecture vids; Dr. K summarized everything I needed clearly. Pearson isn't great for studying just get the extra credit!

Exams are super hard and the course sucks, but Jessica was the most understanding and nice professor I had for bus core. She gives you the L.C's during lecture, which is super helpful. You can fail all the exams and pull a C if you go to office hours for the group cases and do all extra credit. Class ended up being not as bad as I thought.

Great professor but terrible at delivering the content. Exams are insanely difficult and most of the lecture videos and homework are old. Class average is a 65% which is very low for a class at this level

Dr. K is not the greatest lecturer, her classes are useless and she doesn't prepare your for the exams that are insanely difficult. Lecture videos and practice homework are outdated. Most of the stuff you cover in class won't be on the exam. Exams average are 63% and she said it's a good average? Like it's not concerning everyone is failing?
Dr. K is not the greatest lecturer, her class

Awful professor. Her lectures suck, she never explains anything on the slides and just takes the first 5-10 minutes of every class talking about useless stuff. Course is awful no matter what professor you take but she never checks the practice exams so you have no idea what the exam will be covered on. Do extra credit and use anyone else for help.

She is an awful professor, doesn't know whats going on when anyone asks her a question. Practice exams are so easy and then the actual exams are insanely difficult. Lecture videos don't help at all and are a waste of time and slow. Would be better of understanding the material from youtube or Khan Academy.
She is a great person but her lectures were not helpful at all. As a lecturer, Bonnie is much better. But I think Dr. K is much nicer and approachable but her teaching is not the best.

If you are not good at statistics, Dr. K would be the optimal choice for this course. She gives us answers for those Learning catalytic questions and willing to roll back to the slides if needed during each class. In addition, she is easy to talk to if you have questions after class. 10 out of 10 !

Stats 2 is a daunting class, but Dr. K. does her best to ensure that students succeed. She is very accessible outside class, and during lectures she's willing to go over a topic multiple times if students are having trouble understanding the concepts.

This class is very hard, however, Dr. K was amazing and definitely the best professor out of the ones who taught this course. She is very accessible outside of class and if you put in the effort, you will succeed in this class. I found her lectures to be engaging and informative. She is also just a very nice person! Take business stats with her!

BUSOBA2320

Dr K is a very nice person and she is very helpful if you talk to her 1 on 1

That's the only reason I didnt rate her 1/5.

The entire structure of the course revolves around your ability to use statcrunch and conceptual understanding of the material, and then they take away the technology on exams after its all youve really learned.

She is definitely the best option for stats 2320 problem is Bonnie does the lectures and she is absolutely awful and makes you have to teach yourself everything. Dr. K gives you the answers for the lecture problems while the others don't. The class is very hard but Kohlschmidt is better than the rest.

I took the accelerated MBA stats class - it was a lot of work, esp when I hadn't taken any type of Stats class before.  The course was very lecture heavy (recorded weekly lectures plus live lectures).  She was very accessible outside of class and very responsive to questions and willing to work through problems with me to help me understand.

Dr K is a homie and is literally so nice. BUSOBA 2023 is a horrendous class no matter who you take it with but dr k made it doable. she answers her emails in a matter of seconds and actually cares about her students, she goes above and beyond for them. if you are taking this this, definitely do it with her!

She is an average professor who doesn't really have a motivation to teach the class. she has videos where she talks really fast. It is an easy A if you just turn in the homework and have an understanding of statistics but I feel like I didn't learn much. there was not correlation with the subject and industry.
Jessica is a great teacher.

Great teacher. She seems to feel awkward sometimes when no one is participating in class. But overall lecture is great. Make sure you buy the class notes from the bookstore. Jessica gives you the answers to the notes so as long as you fill them out in lecture and study them and do your homework its an easy A. Definitely recommend her!

I would recommend not taking this class from Jessica.  She rushes through all the material and never answers questions.  She rolls her eyes at students who ask questions and is extremely flirtatious with random students in the front row.

If you are going to take STATS 145 do NOT take it from this professor.  She doesn't stop to explain ANYTHING and she laughs off any questions that you may have.  As mentioned in another rating on here....she is flirty which is obnoxious and isn't helpful.  In my 4 years at OSU she is THE WORST teacher I've had.  Stay away.

She is very nice, flirtatious TA, who gives lots of extra credit. For every example you do in class, you get 3 extra credit points added onto your final exam score. This makes it easy to get an A. She is an average teacher as far as explaining the material, but her personality makes her an above average teacher. Defintely take her for stat 427.
She is the best! Take her class if you can because you won't regret it. She is hot and very intelligent.
She is very nice. Didn't like the way she teaches, but I don't regret taking her class. She really understand the students. Take her class if you can!

Do yourself a favor: Drop this class and marry this teacher before someone else does!  Soooo cute and such a sweetheart!  Oh yeah by the way...great teacher with easy and fair tests, bonus questions, extra credit and cheat sheets. Take her class you will have fun!

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and passionate about statistics, with a strong commitment to student success through flexible policies and extra credit opportunities. However, her lectures are often fast-paced and lack clear explanations, making the course challenging for those without prior knowledge. Despite this, many students appreciate her care and willingness to help, finding ways to succeed with additional effort outside of class.

Ratings.comment: She is very clearly educated and experienced in the topics she covers but her ability to convey these ideas to her students is severely lacking lectures move very quickly with minimal explanations. If you have taken AP stats in the past you shouldn't have much issue but for anyone who has no prior experience, I would say stray far away.

She knows what she's doing and is very passionate about statistics, but it is somewhat hard to understand her. As long as you follow along in lecture you're fine. Plenty of opportunities to improve grade with midterm revisions, flexible with midterm make ups, and tophat extra credit.

Very knowledgable of course content and enthusiastic to teach! Always open for questions and takes time to help if you don't fully understand anything. Grading is rather lenient (opportunities to improve midterm grades, somewhat flexible homework policy).
Tests were not too difficult, open note, and not cumulative. Lectures were a bit boring but useful for understanding material. Extra credit offered, overall chill intro class.

you can tell she really cares about her students, lectures are a little boring but she posts the notes and study guides and homeworks arent that bad. She also gave a lot of extra points and tests were very similar to the practice tests.

Sanjee is super kind and really cares about the students' learning. Offers extra credit for attendance, posts lectures on Carmen, and study guides/practice exams that are very similar to the actual exams. I feel like this class is one where you must take time outside lectures to study b/c of the amount of content, but Sanjee made the class easier.

Sanjee was not a great lecturer by any means. However, she is very caring and will go above and beyond to make sure you succeed in her class. Attend lectures and do the study guides with a friend to succeed!

She's an alright lecturer, her lectures often drone for a while. The course Stat2450 is incredibly easy to get an A in, the content can be tricky but the class is pretty slow paced. Exams were really easy, final wasn't even cumulative based off the full semester.

Dr. Sanjeewani is so nice and will give you extra credit. She also gives back points on midterms and if you don't know how to do certain homework questions GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS! She will help you and if you did use up all your tries just email her and she will give you the point at the end of the semester. If you need help GO TO HER OFFICE HOUR!!
Professor herself is really kind and friendly, however, the lectures are completely disaster. If you have her session, just study by yourself and that works much better.

Dr. W is kind and understanding with grading which made this class not stressful. sample tests are the best to review because they are very similar to the real tests Homework is great for examples, definitely do them since there isn't more practice. Ask questions and attend class for in person quizzes, dw u can talk to others and she helps lol!
Okay professor. Didn't like how she organized slides. Once you realize that stats is very meta (even stats have stats), it is an easy class.

Pretty easy class over all, prof does a decent job lecturing and giving good background knowledge to start off with. The class was very test heavy but the tests them selfs we're quite easy. The practice midterms/final we're VERY similar to the tests. Homework can be annoying at times bc of the software, and is significantly harder than the tests.
She is so fair with her tests and
Not a good prof. Doesn't teach material and notes are useless. Only passed because I studied previous exam's answer

This Professor cares about the students and are very understanding and helpful. The difficulty of this class is a bit difficult to explain:

Effort required is something like this:
D - 0.6
C - 0.6
B - 0.8
A - 0.81

The point is that its not one of those class that you can get a B for free, things must be learned. But not as bad as what they say.

She's a very kind a patient professor and you could tell she really wants to help. Her office hours were super helpful. She also gave a huge curve to the class after everyone failed midterm 2 despite the syllabus said there's no curve. The samples she passed out were EXACTLY the same as the actual exam, which made the exam super easy and doable.

I took both 3201 and 3202 from her. I got an A for both classes. Seriously the amount of workload for HW is no joke. One good tip is if you go to her office hour, she literally solves problems for you. What to note though is if the due date gets closer, her office hour gets super crowded. So, you should visit her the week HW gets released.

Sanjee understands the material she is teaching but the structure of the class needs redone. There were only a few homeworks which were the only things that prepared me for the exams. The lectures were hard to understand and follow along with so took lots of reviewing outside of the class.

I took 2450 with Dr. Weerasingha. She was alright. She was a little hard to understand and a little scattered, so I stopped going to lecture after a few weeks. Everything that I needed to succeed were in her lecture notes that she posted, so the class didn't end up being that much of a struggle. I finished with a 97%.

I feel bad saying this, but she is very hard to understand and it doesn't help that her handwriting isn't the best. Although she is not obligated to post them at all, she was very inconsistent with uploading her annotated notes and recorded lectures. Also has a confusing, unorganized carmen page. She didn't create an environment for learning.

I went to a total of like 5 lectures the entire semester but I ended with a 99%. It's because her exams were easy. You're not allowed cheat sheets but I feel like that made her make the papers easier. If you study for the midterm for a solid day or 2 you will get about 90% in them. Final will take 3-4 days and you get a cheat sheet but still doable

Good professor all around. Lectures can be hard to understand with her accent and mic issues, but does her best to make sure you understand what is going on if you ask for help. Not a ton of assignments for the class which is nice. She gives you a practice exam for each exam which is really helpful and lines up well with what is on the exam.

GO TO CLASS. Her lecture material is mundane and her accent is a little thick, but she has very good resources and cares for your attention. Try the homework independently, then go to office hours. She graded our exams with equal weight mainly looking to see that you could recreate problem setups and solution steps.

She teaches the material, just a bit hard to follow sometimes. Gets confused whenever someone asks her a question. Midterms were quite difficult but she curved and gave some bonus points, final was significantly easier and she allowed cheat sheets. Go to lecture and pay attention to all the homework and you should be alright.

I had to teach myself all of the course material for this course. Her handwriting was often illegible, scribbled over, and/or incorrect. Exam content was often not covered in class, homeworks, or quizzes. I would not take this course with this professor again and would not recommend her to anyone.

Please try to get anyone else. She fails as a teacher. Her lectures are hard to follow and consist of her reading of premade slides and simply highlighting parts of it. She fails to explain her work when she answers questions. She is hard to reach via email and inflexible to meet with students outside of office hours. Prepare to learn on your own.

I was not built for this class-

Professor has an accent, making her difficult to understand for some (like me). I found attending the lectures not super helpful, but I currently have a C- so maybe I should start attending lecture again. I also have social anxiety so I haven't made any effort to ask her about things I'm confused about.

Extremely hard to understand. Lectures are very unorganized and sporadic. Helps with tests and exams, however subject material is essentially self taught. Expect to be learning from videos and self teaching.
She is very nice and helpful when asked questions, but lectures are impossible to follow and understand. I advise to not take this class with her unless you can learn your self from the text book
Can't ever understand her lecture and slides. Run away.
so heavy homework

RATING FOR 3202
Dr. Weerasingha is very knowledgeable with the course material, and her online asynchronous lectures were good. She wasn't the best with staying organized, sometimes forgetting to post assignments and lectures or posting them without proper submission portals etc., but would fix them when notified. Would recommend the async section.

Sanjee is the best lecturer in the statistics department hands down. She is able to explain even the most confusing of concepts in simple language. She is a wizard with R and knows everything about statistics. She always answers questions, although it make take a semester or two for her to get back to you. Her lectures are unintentionally funny!

Sanjee is a polarizing figure. If you are new to stats, you might do better with a different professor. If you're already comfortable with probability stuff, she is awesome. Super laid back, tests are extremely easy, and she will pretty much give you the answers if you ask her enough. Taking her again for STAT 3202.

summary_comment: Vu is an effective instructor who provides clear lectures and detailed explanations, though his teaching style can come across as sassy or intimidating at times. His exams are challenging yet fair, and he offers reasonable homework assignments. Despite occasional distractions, such as his reflective surface, students find his overall teaching quality to be much better than expected.

Ratings.comment: Vu gives clear lectures and replies to emails quickly. He is sometimes a bit sassy/intimidating one-on-one, but it's coming from a good place. His exams are difficult but fair, and the HWs are reasonable. His occasionally super shiny head can be distracting during lectures - aside from that, he's much better than I expected.
Teaches well, excellent (free, online) textbook--R4DS 2e. Gave detailed instructions including occasional extra clarifications on the six weekly homeworks.
teacher is amazing, provides very clear videos and explains concepts very clearly. homework is a bit long though.

Vince is a organized teacher, but there were some problems. Firstly, whenever me or people ask for help in the discussion board, Vince would usually say "DId YoU nOT seE the LEcTure VideO?". I did see the lecture and readings and thats why I am asking for help in the first place. Secondly, the homework can be really challenging and really long...

Pre-recorded lectures and weekly hw.I hadn't had stats/math in a while but was able to follow along and do well, though I'm not sure how much I'll be able to apply in real life. Professor had clear expectations and grading structure &was available in a weekly Zoom office hour for questions. Homework is key. Sometimes I wish there were more examples

He's always talking like in 2x speed in his pre-recorded lectures. Have to stop frequently and rewatch several times to understand what he's talking about. I understand that you need to look up stuff for a coding class, but he often tells you to "Google it" in lectures and leaves people confused.

summary_comment: This professor is generally considered ineffective, with students citing his poor explanations, illegible handwriting, and inability to engage large lecture hall audiences. Many found his teaching style unhelpful and confusing, particularly for a supposedly straightforward subject. While some noted he is a nice person and willing to answer questions, the overall consensus is that his teaching methods hinder rather than aid learning.

Ratings.comment: Avoid choosing him as your lecturer. #1 you cannot understand him and he explains things by saying "this is how it works" instead of giving an actual explanation. #2 his handwriting is awful - so there's no point of even trying to read the annotated notes. #3 - we had a subsitite once for a couple days and it was so great. I was able to learn.

I took Stats 3470 with him at Marion. While covered in an earlier post, his teaching style was suitable for the small group of 8 students I was in, and not for a huge lecture hall. My issue with him was his dry lectures. But it did make up for the curved assignments/exams. Genuine guy but not the greatest teacher in my opinion.
nice teacher, willing to answer questions during lectures, good lectures, test covers lots of material, few questions on test, tests are very hard

AVOID. For a class that is supposed to be so simple, it became one of my hardest classes. The information is not portrayed in a clear way whatsoever. You can't read his handwriting so don't get caught behind on what he is saying if you can even understand him He answers questions by saying "do this and that to get that and you get answer" UNHELPFUL

He sounds like a muppet. Seems like a nice guy but his lectures drone on forever. I think he would be a lot better in a smaller class size. He just seemed to have trouble with the giant lecture hall style class. First part of the class was common sense, but all of the sudden it got tough.
Annoying and hard to understand.

Worst Stats professor I've ever had! The boxes he draws for samples will eventually make you twitch. Started out this class thinking he was at least nice, realized it's hard to learn anything they way he teaches. It's unfortunate that I took his class instead of taking the 8:30 option with the other professor. She subbed once and was amazing!

So I chose this prof over the other one offered at a later time b/c he was apparently a little easier. Honestly, you have to be an idiot to not do decently in this class. If you go to class and pay a minimal amount of attention and utilize the fact that we can use cheat sheets on exams, you will do just fine.He really is a nice guy.
Not great at explaining things, but usually good enough. Pretty available. Class is not hard, but the first exam is much easier than the rest. Everything is in the book.

Scored 30 percent above the average in the class for homework scores overall...Averaged a 98 percent for my midterm scores (over 25 percent above the avg in the course) and was above the average on the Final, it was a rough final....Final Course Grade:  89.4%...B+  Do not take if you like your grades...I don't appreciate B+'s for that performance.

summary_comment: Dr. K is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, including clear and helpful lectures that are primarily delivered via video, with class times reserved mainly for exams. She is known for her passion and humor, making the subject matter more engaging, though some find the labs less useful. Kubatko is also well-respected, offering clear lectures and accessible office hours, though her fast-paced delivery can be challenging for some students.

Ratings.comment: Loved Dr K, lectures were videos posted and the class times were only used for exams. All exams were open note and she does review videos. Labs were not very helpful but were a nice grade booster.

Stats sucks but Dr. Kubatko makes it a little better. I was often confused as her lectures are very fast, but her office hours do wonders. If deciding between 2450 and 2480 take 2450 because they have recitation to go over topics and not lab. In lab you use R-studio which if you are not doing anything with statistics later in college is useless.

Dr. K is a great teacher. She is so passionate about statistics and attempts to make you love it too. She sometimes messes up problems halfway through but its hilarious when she does. She's super funny and relatable. One homework assignment a week. Quizzes easy and midterms not bad. She says final is formally cumulative but its not cumulative.

Kubatko is a very nice professor with clear lectures. She is approachable and always in a good mood. Class isn't too bad, I thought it was more trouble than it was worth but probably due to my focus being on other courses that semester. Exams were pretty easy and it was always clear what would be on/covered on the exam. Can't go wrong with her

She is an amazing professor! She was very clear on class content and the tested material. She is a very busy lady, but is happy to meet with students outside of class if you email her. The homework affects your grade more than you think so keep using multiple attempts until you get a perfect. The book is also pretty helpful if you need more help.

Lectures were very clear and straightforward in terms of the material and what would be tested on quizzes and exams. She's very eager to help and is eager to answer questions in class and outside of class (through email or office hours. Very kind and wants her students to succeed.

Laura is an amazing professor. She is super nice and very easy to get along with. She cares about her students. She is very busy, but if you want to meet her outside of class, she will try her best to squeeze time out of her busy schedule for you.

Dr. K is a great professor. She is so kind, and her lectures are extremely helpful. She does a great job of answering any questions. The material can be kind of tricky, but she explains everything thoroughly. I would definitely take her class again. Virtually no homework, three quizzes, two midterms, and a final exam.

Dr. K is an incredible lecturer - I feel like she moved at a really good pace, had excellent explanations, was very responsive to questions inside and outside of the classroom. The material can be kind of tough at times but every exam / quiz was very fair. Ask questions. Notes posted online but they only make sense if you go to lecture.

Class is stat for the life sciences (she's also in the EEOB dept). I was worried about the calc portion of the class, but thankfully it's never tested. 2 quizzes, 2 exams with cheatsheets. She's a very good lecturer with great handwriting, and the hw are very helpful. Study/practice from those and it's fully possible to get a 100% in this class.

SEI.Subject: EEOB
SEI.Class Name: EEOB Graduate Seminar: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in Science

summary_comment: Professor Baker is known for being humorous and having engaging lectures, though his content can be disorganized and lectures may cause confusion. Students find his grading practices opaque and often struggle with unexpected deductions. While some appreciate his accessibility and extra credit opportunities, others find the class challenging and unhelpful recitations.

Ratings.comment: Never responds email. Unhelpful recitation by a TA. A lot of recitation paper to solve and homework online separately for only 3 credits hours. Online textbook sucks and does not allow round error. Never tell you recitation grade till the end of semester. Just avoid it. Definitely okay for DA students not to take it to pre-study stat and prob.
Baker is a humorous professor, but sometimes his lectures can be difficult to comprehend. The slides are not very helpful and may cause confusion. However, overall, he is a great professor.

No grading transparency. Random grades in the gradebook that were not reflected in the syllabus. Horrible lecture style, seems like he doesn't know his own content. Exams are easy, but he will tank your grades with all the random grades he decides to put in just for sh**s and giggles.

Disorganized and unclear about grading, due dates, and the setup of the entire class. Uses online third party source for his exams which aren't too bad but are harder than his own written exams that he used in the past, which also had partial credit. Only redeeming factor is the extra credit offered, but is also unclear about that.

He was an enthusiastic and fun professor with little homework, but things were not always clearly explained. You definitely have to be proactive in learning and practicing outside of class because of the light work load. All exams are online and open note, and lectures are available via zoom.

The content was a bit disorganized in comparison to the textbook, HW, and Quizzes, but Baker had great lectures. Very funny, respectable guy. Doesn't teach you formulae by hand, but how to compute them online and in TI-84; very efficient. Accommodating for students who wanted to be online for class. Accessible if you email him and ask for help.

Dr. Baker was a funny guy, but his lectures were not helpful and disorganized.  If you don't do well on something it really hurts your grade.  Always answer the tophat question because that is apart of your attendance grade. Recitations were not helpful. Dr. Baker goes off topic and the notes were never helpful for me.
The class was kinda hard, and Dr. Baker wasnt very accessible outside of class which made learning very hard. Chegg carried me through this class.
lecture is just awful, fast speed and no explanation of everything. Quiz are not difficult, but the grading system of quiz is just tough.

Yes, the class is pretty disorganized, but as long as you keep track of what's going on and keep up learning with the textbook in advance before the lectures since he goes insanely fast, you will do fine, expect to use a lot of calculator/Crunchit, but that's the good part, little to no math on your part, and I love Dr.Baker for his personality

The 1 star is for personality. Dr. Bakers funny but his lectures are impossible to follow, I passed the AP Stats test and still felt lost. Hes quick to give accommodations but beware because he NEVER answers email. Had to contact the director a month after he told me I could make up a test because he never answered my 27 emails or zoom messages.

At the end of the semester he admitted to doing worse than usual, so maybe in other semesters he will be more on top of the class, but this one was so stressfully disorganized. Luckily he was forgiving with grades because of it. You never know what assignments are due when, the lectures are missing a bunch of stuff, and it was just so stressful.

Dr. Baker is so disorganized and does not care to ever answer any students emails. He also does not answer the TAs emails. His lectures are confusing and the examples do not make much sense with the material. Hes a nice guy but hes a horrible professor.

He won't ever respond to your emails. He doesn't even respond to TAs emails from what it sounds like. He may have potentially been more busy this semester but he is still a professor at the end of the day and his performance was sub-par. The class material was thankfully easy since most things could just be plugged into the calculator.

Most disorganized professor I have ever had. He never responded to emails and never changed my quiz grade that the online homework portal messed up from week 4 of the semester. Inaccessible to both students and TAs. Go to class for attendance, but you are better off learning from Khan Academy.
Will not respond to his emails no matter what. Teaches his lectures too quickly and is impossible to keep up with.

He's a very funny and entertaining person, and you can tell he truly wants to engage his students. However, he is incredibly disorganized and if you are taking his class online, you will sometimes struggle to get your question answered or be able to fill in all the notes.

I took his online class and as lots of people have already said he is a personable and funny guy. His exams are pretty fair as they pretty much cover the same things in the weekly hw and quiz. At times the online class is a bit disorganized but nothing too bad for me.

Dr Baker is very cool and down to earth. He knows the stuff and knows how to treat his students. His exams are not too difficult. He gives opportunity for extra credits. I'll recommend him taking him especially for any STATS class

Offered abundant chances for extra credit throughout semester. Gave a fair amount of assignments but never too much. Exams were provided through course learning software (Sapling) but were not too hard. Really cares for each and every student. Wants to see students earn good grades. Very accommodating as well. An excellent and knowledgeable prof.
Dr. Baker is very hilarious when teaching Stats. If you stay up with the material this class is not that bad.

Dr. Baker is comedic. He makes statistics personable and relatable, making lots of jokes. Everything else about this class was a joke, too. The midterm/final are difficult, comprising 70% of the grade. His poor articulation in lecture means you should develop a relationship with your TA as soon as possible. No curve but slight grade scale change.

He is better one on one than he is in person. Go to his office hours outside of class. he skips a lot of material in lecture and doesn't stay focused. His tests are fair and if you use the study guide it will aid you preparing for the test.

A funny guy. Good at teaching stats too and tries to make stats relatable to students with sports and current event examples. He'll really help you out if you go to office hours. Only complaint is the final is worth 30% of your grade you really have to rock it out the whole time. Can't just get to an A early in the semester and relax.

Awful professor. It got so bad that 30 students went to report him but nothing happened because he is the head of the department. We had our first midterm well after the point to drop without petitioning and it took him 16 days to grade it. The class ends next week, and I have no idea how I am doing.
He is a good statistics professor. I think he is good at business statistics.
He is a good statistics professor. He is an interesting elder.
Dr. Baker is hilarious. Hes a very personable guy and homework is very light. Exams are a breeze and he wants his students to get good grades.
I did not think he was a bad teacher, but the things he taught us and the homework and quizzes we took every week on Sapling were different, so that made it hard.

I heard great things about Dr. Baker, but they didn't really show through on the online class. He was often late in posting the week's materials, sometimes waiting until Thursday (when the homework is due Friday). At the in-person exams, I could see he was funny just like everyone said, but unfortunately, I didn't really love his online section.

Dr. Baker was a great professor! Even for someone who doesn't like math, he made his lectures easy to follow and engaging. The class is very clearly laid out for you: no surprises- just 1 homework and 1 quiz per week and a few midterms!
Dr. Baker's lectures could be confusing, with lots of examples. But that's how math can be. The tests were very fair and you could definitely get an A in this class.

I didn't do well in 1450, but mostly because it was easy for me to get lost in his "steps for success." He does outline how to solve problems in lecture in a lot of detail, but I found that his steps were more than necessary. If you just learn how to do the homework well (don't use google) every week and do his practice exams, you'll be fine.

Dr. Baker definitely makes learning statistics better, with his humor and engagement with the people in the class. He is interested in getting to know students and ensuring that they succeed. Attendance definitely has a decent impact on your grade, and his practice exams, in my experience have been helpful when  preparing for the test.

Dr Baker was AMAZING. Math in the middle of the afternoon was not my idea of a good time. But he made this class so enjoyable. He even danced to "Juju on that Beat" on stage for us. This was my second time taking Stats (1st at a different school) and I am so glad he was my professor for it. Definitely recommend him!

Dr. Baker is one of my favorite professors. He is very funny and always willing to help. He holds office hours right before his lectures and exams. GO TO THEM. He will drop extremely obvious hints about what will and will not be on the exam.

Amazing professor and very easy class. More than willing to help you if you need it and his tests are extremely fair if you're going through lecture, homework, recitation, and quizzes. Only missed about 10 points in the whole class. I suggest taking this class in person if you have no statistics background and/or are not self-motivated.
Funny guy but wouldn't recommend if you want to actually learn the content. He isn't the best at explaining concepts.

Dr. Baker is so hilarious, and even came to lecture on Halloween in a costume. Uses TopHat to take attendance, which is graded. He is a really great professor, and is always willing to help during his office hours. Provides you with old exams that are very similar in content to the exams you take. He was great to learn from. Would highly recommend.

I have taken Cal 1, math 1172, linear algebra and passed with an A. However, this course is very difficult. I strongly believe it is because Dr Baker isn't the best professor. He is funny but that doesn't help me honestly. His tests are very difficult. The study guide he provides suck. Don't rely on them like I did. Probably gonna fail unless curve

I enjoyed taking Stats with Dr. Baker. He's funny and laid back (he even did a lecture in costume during halloween.) The lectures were straightforward and all the slides were available online, though he regularly took attendance via TopHat in class. The exams weren't difficult. He was a flexible grader.

I really enjoyed Dr. Baker's teaching style, though I recognize it may not be the best for everyone. Because everything builds on everything else, it is important to have good attendance, otherwise the brief explanations he gives in class might get lost in the shuffle. Funniest professor I've had, and very willing to help with questions.

Dr. Baker is incredibly nice and has the jokes, but his class requires some effort.  There's online homework and quizzes which aren't necessarily hard, but his tests can be difficult.  Takes attendance every class.  Very nice professor, but expect to spend some time on the material to get an alright grade.

Dr. Baker is nice guy but not great lecturer because he is not very clear about his explanation and skipping steps made it more difficult to follow. His exams are relatively hard and long for the amount of time given. Not recommended unless you have good statistic background!

Dr. Baker is a great guy, outside of the classroom. His teaching style is very laid back, to the point where it almost isn't teaching at all. He just goes through a powerpoint and students follow along in the notes, but he's never clear on what he's doing or how he got answers. Very difficult to learn from.

I had him for an online class so I never actually talked to him, but he seemed nice enough in his videos.  He did tend to drag on a bit on easy concepts. The only problem I had was that he constantly changed the dates of assignments and with an online class I wasn't checking daily to see if he had changed the due date once again.

Dr. Baker does not explain the concepts well as statistics is a whole different set of concepts than what most people have seen before. He is a nice professor but is not very good at explaining the content.  He goes through a slideshow with the solutions worked out but doesn't explain where each # comes from or why he solved it in that way.

Dr. Baker is a genuine teacher that will listen and try to be as flexible as possible and he also understands that outside factors play in a student's life also. Stats not really my thing but he made the class interesting. You may get called on in class to respond and you should be able to do so and give the reason why.

His lectures were interesting because he liked to joke around, and he keeps you involved by using a software called Tophat to answer questions about lecture that he used for attendance purposes.  But statistics just is not an easy subject unless you are good at math.  I thought the tests were okay, but I am a math minor.

In the beginning, the class was common sense. Later on, it got tough because I did not take it seriously. When I did take it seriously, it actually was easy. Everything builds upon each other, so you have to keep up. Dr. Baker is awesome and so are his lectures. If you see him in his office hours, he breaks down the stats real nicely.

Dr. Baker is a great guy, but this class certainly wasn't easy. As the semester went on, concepts seemed to become more and more unclear and they all built off of each other. All I can say is practice on your own more than just the mandatory homework and go for help before you get too deep and it's too late. Also slightly curved.

I never actually dealt with Dr. Baker, only his TA, but the class is definitely doable. The midterms are easy, the final is a bit harder. There might be a tiny curve which is good. There's homework every week where you get 2 attempts at each problem and then there's a quiz which isn't too bad. I would recommend his class.

Baker is truely a great guy. In a lecture of 400-500 kids he tried to get to know and memorize names. Has notes that you print out and bring to class and just fill in the blanks. He often makes reference to Drake and Migos which is funny. He doesnt really believe in extra credit and midterms are okay but the finals tricky.

summary_comment: Dr. Zhang is a knowledgeable professor who genuinely loves statistics but struggles with clear lecture organization, focusing过多的细节可能会影响简洁性。以下是简化后的版本：

Ratings.comment: Dr. Zhang's lectures are a bit disorganized and often go into proofs more than the main ideas, and most of the class often don't follow him. Interestingly his exams are extremely easy compared to the practice exams and homework, and the homework is also shorter compared to the other STAT 3201 classes.

Dr. Zhang is a very intelligent professor. I think he thinks that he can teach at his own pace and everyone in the class understands it. The homeworks take forever to do and don't really help clarify anything. His exams are extremely difficult. the average for exam 2 was a 42 + final was not much better. curves a ton but not sure if ready for 4202

Prof. Zhang is a really nice guy who I can tell genuinely loves Statistics and wants his students to learn. The class has an intimidating amount of proofs and intense calculus in the homework and notes, a little less in the exams, which gave me a decent amount of anxiety. However, it is all balanced by the heavy curves and lowly weighted homework.

He curves like crazy, which I know makes people want to take this class. However, he has to curve, since his averages are so low. Lecture & homework are all theory, proofs, and needless calc that arent replicated on the exam. The only thing the exam has in common with the lecture is ridiculous calculus. Got a good grade, but not worth the headache.
He is a great professor with many example problems for you to learn. Most important ishe curves a lot on exams.
