Dr. Rodgers quite literally is the most boring lecturer ever. He asks questions and sits in silence till someone answers even if it is a hard topic and no one truly knows. He seems like a nice person but I learned all of the work from Chegg and YouTube not him.
Keith is the most boring lecturer ever. I almost fell asleep several times during his class. He just reads off the power point the entire class. I learned everything in the class from my TA.

This was a difficult class, and Prof. Rogers wasn't helpful. In the lectures, he would go on and on about things that had nothing to do with math. The lectures consisted of him asking a question and staying silent until someone knew it. I swear half of the class time was wasted like that. Unless you are good at teaching yourself, don't pick him.

Keith is very odd. His lectures are boring, so it was hard to stay awake. Content is super easy so it makes up for how dry his lectures are. Do the homework and have a basic understanding of the material and you will get an A. Therefore, I would try to get a different professor if possible to hopefully make it somewhat interesting for you.

This was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. But, Keith was dry, boring, and weird. He read off the powerpoint slides. He would ask for participation and wait until he got it. Exams and homework are easy so you will do fine with him as your professor. But, if you have the option to take someone else I would for your own sanity.

I have never had a more boring professor than Keith. I only went to lecturers to socialize with my friend and for TopHat; his lectures are horrible and he is not good at explaining things, I taught myself everything. He also likes to interrupt you and not answer your questions directly. With that being said, if you put the effort in youll do fine.

Only gave him a 2 because you can't help but feel bad for the poor guy. As many have already said, you'll learn much much more from recitation/your TA. The only reason to go to class would be to get the extra credit questions and fill in the notes maybe. I'd recommend taking another professor, honestly.

This class was the easiest class that I ever taken. The homework can be a little tough, but most of the answers come straight from the lecture notes that are given to you. A sheet of notes was allowed to be used on the midterm and final exam, so you really don't have to study for them at all. This class seriously was so easy.

Keith is a very interesting professor. Get ready for awkward classes (he asks a question and will wait for a response no matter how long it takes). I was only really able to pass this class with Stattutors which is a tool available on sapling when you sign up for it in this course because going to class isnt just enough to pass.

Keith is a straight savage. Really bad at lecturing and really boring but the class isn't hard. He will wait 10 min for you to answer and if you answer wrong expect to be interrupted with a "wELL nO" He has a weird accent too. Sometimes shows up late but expects you to wait for him. Only reason I did well was bc of my TA.

Wicked nice guy but the class was beyond boring. Fell asleep multiple times, you can tell her loves stats but doesn't have the right teaching technique. The material was extremely easy and no one should have any issue passing the class as long as you show up.

Keith wasn't that good at lecturing and that's all that professors do in STAT1350. I had this class in the morning and almost fell asleep because I was so bored all the time. The material is bland and so was the way it was taught. He's a nice guy though. As long as you do your homework and study, you can get an A or a B.

Weird accent (semi-british?) makes it sometimes hard to understand him during lecture. Very interactive style of lecture, which may or may not work. When he asks a question in lecture, he expects an answer, even if it takes 5 minutes for someone to come up with it. When giving an answer, speak loudly and confidently.

Awesome instructor. He is very intelligent and fair grader. Lecture can move quickly at times, so if you need one on one guidance just ask! It's really not that difficult. If anything was wrong with this class, it was the students not taking it seriously. So don't be a jerk in class and pay attention. You will learn a lot.

Keith was clear with his material and was even willing to teach topics out of the syllabus. He made things pretty clear and made sure we understood concepts clearly. Very helpful and is even ready to help students outside class.

Keith is such a good guy and he means well, but hes such a bad lecturer. i came out of lecture more confused than when i came in. and when we would ask for clarification, we didnt get it. not only this, but he constantly let us out late. his notes are illegible. going to recitation is the only way that i am passing this class. 0/10 lecturer

SEI.Subject: STAT
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to the Practice of Statistics

SEI.Subject: STAT
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to the Practice of Statistics

summary_comment: Patrick is an engaging and humorous lecturer who provides detailed and helpful notes, making the class challenging but manageable with his support during review sessions and office hours. Students find him genuinely nice and committed to their learning, though the exams are tough and heavily weighted, which can be stressful despite some curving and a note sheet provided for exams. Overall, while the class is demanding, many students appreciate his efforts and find him to be a great professor.

Ratings.comment: Class was pretty hard, but Patrick was a good lecturer and gave lots of examples.

He was a super good lecturer and very funny. The exams were 80% of the final grade, but he made sure to hold a lot of review sessions and his office hours were very helpful. Exams were a lot harder than expected, but he did curve them a tiny bit. Hard class, but great professor.

Class is difficult with tough heavily weighted midterms. Lots of online homework and quizzes that are generally fairly simple. His lectures are very detailed with entertaining examples. He does midterm and final review sessions and definitely cares a lot about the class. It would be an amazing class if the exams were just 10-15% easier.

He was truly such a nice person and honestly so funny. His lecture notes were very very detailed and explained almost everything. He was always offering help if needed, and the HW wasn't that bad to do. The exams were kinda hard though- a lot of material and you really needed to understand it. You did have a note sheet that saves you on the exams.
Patrick is a great professor that clearly explains everything. To do well in his class you simply have to be able to solve the examples he goes over in lecture.

The tests were unreasonably weighted and it was impossible to get your grade back after a bad midterm. There was no extra credit and lots of homework/quizzes. I went to his office hours very often and always thought I understood the material. He is down-to-earth and humorous, but the structure of the class needs to change. It is far too difficult.

summary_comment: Dr. Kelbick is perceived as an effective instructor for straightforward subjects, showing genuine care for her students and flexibility in her policies. However, her teaching style is criticized for being monotonous and lacking depth, often relying heavily on textbook content without sufficient explanation or engagement. Many students find it more effective to supplement her lectures with external resources or to take the class online where they can better focus and manage their learning pace.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kelbick is lucky that her material is relatively easy to understand because if I only listened to her teaching I would have failed the class. The only way to learn her material is through practice problems because her regurgitation of the textbook makes it clear that even she doesn't understand the material.

i took this course online. we never had to go to class even though we had a meeting time. the only time we met is for exams which are proctored through zoom (cam and mic on). she makes sooo many mistakes on practice questions and even on exams. grading is easy though and hw and lab quizzes are unlimited attempts. i had to rush on exams bc of time

She seems entirely unprepared every single lecture, and looks at the slides as if it's her first time seeing them. She cancelled the first ever class we had, and assigned us lecture videos to watch instead. She doesn't publish any exams from previous semesters to help you prepare. You're better off skipping lecture and watching youtube videos.
Very scattered and all over the place. Forgets to mention subject matter. Trails off a lot and does not explain things well at all. Youtube will be your best friend if you have her.

Take this class online!!!! If you're reading this and you already scheduled, go back and fix it. In my opinion, Dr. Kelbick is a very nice person, but not the best lecturer. Her online classes are easier to stay focused on. I ended up just going back and listening to lectures because I couldn't stay focused in class.

Professor Kelbick is passionate about what she does, but her monotone voice makes it nearly impossible to stay focused on what is being talked about. Attendance begins to dwindle during the second/third week of the semester, and most of the students are watching the lecture videos instead of going to class. Even so, the tone is still draining.

Professor Nicole is a genuinely good professor who truly cares about her students. Even during her office hours, she reaches out and answers everything in the lab, explaining concepts clearly. If you watch her lecture videos, you will simply excel in her course. If I ever take a statistics class, I want her to be the professor.

Dr. Kelbick's stats 2480 class was extremely straightforward, which I appreciated. She also clearly cares about students, was flexible with deadlines, and was easy to talk to. There are frequently mistakes in her slides presentations. Her lectures aren't captivating to most, but statistics can tend to be a dry subject anyway.

Professor Kelbick was an okay professor. For me, the material was not interesting at all and I found it difficult to pay attention to her lectures. She does well in helping individual people with the class. To prepare for exams, just look over the slides and you should be good. Many problems seem difficult, but can be solved easily using the TI-84.

Coming from someone who is unbias, I thought Kelbick was an overall solid class. Her exams were not too hard and the other grades were easy to obtain. Her lectures were very boring, but the class material was not overly complicated. If you review the slides and know how to do the practice problems, you will be good.
VERY GOOD

Professor Kelbick is a lecturer who cares about her students. She gives feedback on difficult hw problems and explains them to the entire class. Her lectures are more boring but were super helpful for tips and tricks. I would definitely use the textbook as a supplement.
Extremely disorganized and boring lectures. Prof was very confusing and I ended up using the textbook to learn the material, rather than her notes. Would avoid her class if possible.

Her lectures are useless if you're not paying her attention to her rambling and very boring regurgitation of the material from the textbook. I stopped going to lectures a quarter of the way through the semester and I ended up doing better not relying on her slides and instead relying on the textbook. Read the textbook if you end up taking her!

professor kelbick is a kind and accessible professor, but lectures are very boring and non-informative. all tests and quizzes are open note so just prepare good notes and you'll be okay. she doesn't mind giving extensions on assignments if you really need it

Had her for Stats lecture 2x a week. I only went for the first month. Her class is a snooze fest and I learned more from the TA who was more informative and entertaining. A few times she got so angry about not being ale to connect her computer- she let us leave at the start of class. Fairly easy class- just super boring if Stats isn't your forte.

Girlfriend is actually bonkers. I swear everything she says she doesn't think about before hand. Seriously only passed this class because I took statistic in high school. If you can seriously avoid this women. The frustration she causes is NOT worth it.

Dr. Kelbick is a sweet and understanding person, but it is impossible to stay focused during her lectures. There is a lack of cohesion from topic to topic, and her monotone voice will put you to sleep. However, she is an easy grader and can be persuaded to add points to a test grade if your argument is good enough. Read the book!!

Prof Kelbick is extremely nice and you can tell she genuinely cares about her student's success- she's always there to help. BUT- she is just not a good teacher. Took her for 5301, 90% of the class just stopped going to lecture and taught themselves the material with the book. Unorganized/dry lectures, but content is 100% doable-just teach yourself

Professor Kelbick can be a little scatterbrained at times, but the course material is easy enough that it can still be learned during the lecture. Recitation is more helpful than lecture. Kelbick is a nice person, just not a great lecturer. She spends a lot of time going over practice problems that don't require that much attention.

If you take her, prepare to teach yourself everything in this class. She really does not teach the students, rather she runs SAS code and then mumbles a bit and moves onto something else. She needs to explain what and why the code is written a certain way, and have more organized lectures. Total waste of time. She needs to make improvements.

Relatively easy, gets more difficult after the midterm. Nicole's lectures were pretty scattered and don't keep your attention. You can get extra credit for going to class thru TopHat (up to 10 points). I found recitation to be more helpful than lectures. Highly recommend printing the exam practice problems and reviewing that to study.
I personally loved Nicole and thought she was a great professor. Easiest math class Ive ever had.
Hard course with no curve. The professor is not caring in general.
She is amazing, and better than other as a personal opinion. I love her class and I Would recommend her. SHE CARES

For a 5000-level class, this class was easy af. If you've ever taken AP stats or a entry level stats class you'll be fine. Nicole is nice but highly unorganized. Also, she is incapable of captivating anyone. Her lectures are scattered and move very slowly. Very quick to lose your attention. Homeworks use R. Exams are what you'd expect
Extremely easy class. I barely showed up the entire semester. She may be unorganized in class but extremely helpful during office hours.

Lectures were poor. Prof. Kelbick was often unprepared and would often do examples incorrectly or pause for a few minutes to read the textbook. She did seem to care, so I felt bad for her that she struggled during lectures. Exams were fairly simple and only required basic knowledge of statistics.

This was one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. She was pretty unorganized and taught very slow. Going to class was unnecessary because all the notes were posted online. Don't bother going to her office hours cause she doesn't go either.

Professor Kelbick may not be the most organized professor but she cares about her students and is very nice. If you took stats in high school, this class won't be very hard. If you try in this class you can get an A. If you don't do well on one of the midterms but you do well on the final and homework she will boost your grade.
She is super nice, generous, very helpful and considerate.

She is really nice and wants her class to learn. That being said, the class moves extremely slowly. I didn't see any new material all semester -- it was all high school level (or even lower). The homework and tests are very easy. I was hoping for derivations and mathematical rigor, but the class was far too simple and basic for that.

Professor Kelbick is one of the nicest professors you will meet, but I do not think she is especially good at teaching.  She often gets confused by questions asked and ends up answering them incorrectly.  I use the Mark Risser's lectures to help me learn (they are all on YouTube) because he is a better teacher. Tests are easy (have extra credit).

So, she's not spectacular. That said, she's definitely not the worst option. And she's definitely one of the nicest profs I've had, she was always willing to work with students on due dates. She's not the best lecturer but she did get better as the semester went on. Take her over Bach, but be prepared to put in some work outside of class.

Dr. Kelbick just returned from a 10 year hiatus raising her kids to teach again.  She was still adjusting to academic life and that's totally understandable.  She was very accessible outside of class and gave very very fair tests.  I ended up with a 97 on the final exam despite struggling in the beginning of the semester.  I would recommend.

Nicole is incredible caring and understanding. Although it did take her some time to get into the swing of things, her tests were very straightforward. Mark risser's videos help a ton for the exams. homeworks weren't too bad. Overall, nicole is a good/easy option for stats 3470.

She isn't an amazing lecturer, but she isn't that bad, and it doesn't matter because Mark Risser's videos on YouTube explain everything in the class perfectly.  She is super caring about her students and takes their feedback to heart.  The tests were very straightforward. I would highly recommend taking her for this class. 1000x better than Bach.
Does not teach reads the slides that are basically copied from textbook

I'll be honest, she is not a good teacher.  HOWEVER, her tests are SUPER easy if you know what you are doing. You get a cheat sheet for every exam, and she offers up to 12% extra credit. If you have taken stats before then you might consider taking this just for an easy A. Just don't plan on actually learning anything.

She cant explain everything clear in class. However, her slices posted online are really helpful. Please please please read them. U can pass the test. The average is fine but she said she will curve the class grade. U can take cheat sheet in each exam which make the class more competitive.

Usually comes to class disorganized and spends 10mins of class preparing. She puts up a text doc onscreen (no slides) and scrolls through it while she talks. For lack of a better way of saying it she doesn't explain ANYTHING. She shows an equation and then a word problem and jumps straight to answers with no in-between steps.  I advise you avoid.

summary_comment: Professor Blevins offers a moderately paced class that is neither overly challenging nor easy, requiring consistent attendance due to attendance-based grades. While the quizzes and exams allow for open notes, the grading can be stringent. Overall, opinions vary, with some finding the class worthwhile and others less so.

Ratings.comment: Not worth it
lowww taper fade XD

I enjoyed Prof. Blevins class very much. The class isn't that challenging, but it is also not an easy A. You do have to make sure that you come to every class as she takes a grade on attendance, but usually she puts the lecture notes online as well. All quizzes and Exams were open note, but she was often a tricky grader.

summary_comment: The professor's lectures were perceived as boring, and her grading system, while lenient in dropping one exam score, was otherwise criticized for its late weighting. Homework assignments were described as long and tedious, and the inclusion of a group presentation and project added to the workload. Despite being her first time teaching the course, the overall teaching quality was considered subpar.

Ratings.comment: Lectures were really boring and she didn't weight the grades until the end of the semester which was annoying. There were only two exams and she dropped one which was nice, but the homeworks are incredibly long and tedious. There's also a group presentation and a group project. It was her first time teaching this class, but it still wasn't great.

summary_comment: Professor Paul is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and supportive approach, often praised for providing ample extra credit opportunities and clear, helpful responses to student inquiries. While some find the material and lectures somewhat dry, students appreciate his generosity in grading and the flexibility of writing formula sheets for exams. Overall, he is considered a reliable choice for any statistics class.

Ratings.comment: first class ever where I ended up with a 102%, and that's mostly thanks to him

One of the best statistics professors I've had here at OSU. Gives you everything you need to succeed in the class, and is super nice as well. Every assignment has bonus points. Honestly can't say enough good things about Professor Paul and this course.

Call him Superdeep because he is one of the best teachers in OSU. Absolute GigaChad. Take him for any stat class.

He was effective at teaching.  Exams and HWs had extra credit and were fair, but not easy. 

The strat to prepare for exams and HW: do practice problems in blank lecture notes and then compare your work with the annotated lectures.

The content was extremely boring to me but I am also a burnt out senior so mileage may vary. Otherwise though, he is a very nice guy who welcomes any questions and is effective enough in communicating the material. He is a safe bet for any class he teaches.

A nice professor who is always willing to answer questions and responds to emails quickly. I found the grading to be quite generous and there were extra points on homeworks and exams. Only problem I had in this class was that his handwriting was hard to read.

Material was boring and lectures weren't too exciting, but you get to write a formula sheet for every exam. He is a nice professor and always stops to answer questions. I wouldn't skip the lectures too much, however--he posts the notes online but it usually takes him a few days to upload them. Attend lectures if you don't want to make up the notes.

summary_comment: Professor Duda is known for her supportive and accommodating approach, making her class accessible even in an asynchronous format. Students appreciate her detailed responses and helpfulness, though some find her lectures challenging to follow due to her fast pace and dense content. While the homework and quizzes are generally manageable, the exams are noted for being lengthy and difficult, requiring significant preparation and self-discipline.

Ratings.comment: Very chill professor, cares about her students. If you need help go to the class office hours and use them. Also if you ever have something sudden happen before an exam - don't hesitate to reach out, she is very accomodating. Class overall is easy if you took AP Stat, and if you study a little more you can get that A. Don't slack on the homeworks.

Professor Duda does a great job at striking a balance between making her class rigorous yet accessible to students. For an asynchronous class, she does a great job at communicating with students. Her lectures are entertaining but admittedly hard to follow on occasion. Provides extremely helpful and detailed answers to questions.

It's an online asynchronous course, and Professor Duda runs it well and is responsive. All the lectures are available with guided notes, a textbook, and practice exams and questions. The HWs can be long but its only one per week, easy to spread out. STAT 3470 is tougher than STAT 3450 and the exams are quite long. Don't take if you can't self-pace.

The lecture is recordings from several years ago. The recording is blurred, so it is difficult to see the words/letters from the videos. Her speech pacing is extremely fast. It is difficult to catch up with what she says. She rarely answers the questions from the homework and exams. DO NOT take her class
She is very kind and will always answer any questions very quickly. The only difficult part about this class is the exams, but she provides ample practice material so you have no reason to do poorly.

Prof. Duda is a good professor. The homework and quizzes are a cakewalk. However, the exams are a challenge. I managed to blunder both and pulled it together for the final. It's not a hard class by any means, just one mistake is enough to doom your grade. Notes are excellent and she will help you if needed.

Her notes and practice she gives before exams seem easy, but her exams are very very tough and lengthly. She allows cheat sheets which makes these exams harder, so honestly the cheat sheet really doesn't help because I would rather just have a few questions on my exam and have a prof give us the formula sheet instead. Try to pick a diff prof!

Her lecture videos are really hard to follow because she has her lecture notes filled out beforehand. She just glosses over the information, which makes it tough to keep up and understand the material in depth. Overall seems like a very nice person and is open for help.

She was really great and you can tell she really likes teaching. The course can be difficult at times but she will wants you to succeed. If you prepare a good enough notes sheet based on the notes and hw you can get a 100 on the exams like I did.

If you passed AP Stats, do everything you can to get out of this class. We only reached "new" content in the last two weeks of the semester. That being said, Professor Duda is a really good professor and is good at explaining things to people who have not learned any statistics content before, and her tests were fair. Overall good experience.
Prof Duda is awesome. She is a good lecturer and genuinely cares about her students.

Michelle was a great professor for engineering statistics; her lectures were clear and straightforward. As long as you understand what's going on in lectures and do the homework (a very manageable workload), you'll do well in the class.

Great professor. She teaches through the use of guided notes. These will be your study guide. They will contain everything you need to do well on homework and tests. Missed class? Copy them from a friend. Be careful on the homework, it's easy to make dumb mistakes. But generally if you can't pass this class you shouldn't be in college.

I'm horrible at math. Coming in to this class was frightening, I was taking it for a Data Analysis GE credit. Michelle made everything very easy to understand, gave fill in the blank notes, and encouraged questions during a large lecture course. We were allowed to have a sheet of notes for both exams, and the HW/ Lab activities were open note!
Kind person and amazing lecture.

Duda was very good at explaining things clearly. DON'T BUY THE BOOK-not needed. She gave many examples, which made it easy to learn. You get a notebook paper for the two exams- midterm + final. Sometimes the concepts were so easy that lectures were boring but that was not really a fault of hers just the material. Easy A if you put a little time in.

Michelle made material incredibly easy to comprehend, with a simplified explanation for everything and many examples. I did purchase the textbook detailed in the syllabus, but honestly, her lectures were clear enough to not need further clarification. Very generous with extra credit as long as you show up to class and answer the TopHat question.

She is really great at explaining things, and gives a lot of examples to make sure everyone understands. The material isn't difficult and she makes it seem even easier, and the homeworks and labs are also easy. There is one midterm and the final is noncumulative so this was overall a really great course in conjunction with my other harder classes!

Duda gives fill-in-the-blank type note sheets before class which makes it easier. She is very clear when teaching and gives good examples, she also cracks some jokes here and there. It can get a little boring, but so do all lectures. There's an online homework due once a week which is pretty easy if you use your notes. Overall pretty easy.

Very clear lecturer. Everything was straightforward and she was engaged with her students. She explained the concepts very clearly, almost to a fault. Often times I found myself zoning out b/c of all the examples for a single topic. We were a few lectures behind and I wished the class was faster. But that's a minor criticism, overall very good.
Good professor. Teaches us step by step.

She's one of my favorite professors I've had. She's very kind and understanding and her lectures are very easy to understand. Showing up and listening is usually enough to understand the concepts. The tests aren't difficult and the homework isn't time consuming.

Gave out handouts before class to write notes on during her enjoyable and relatable lectures. Get a folder and not a notebook for this class. She lets students use equation sheets for the tests which makes the exams a breeze. If you show up to lecture, take notes, and do the homework (about 30-45 mins a week), you'll have an easy A in the class.
Really funny and relaxed. Her lectures are very clear and she explains things great.

Michelle was a great professor, gave very clear lectures, put material on the exams that was covered in class, clearly cares about stats and her students. Her notes are thorough and easy to understand, I did not read the textbook at all throughout the semester.

Great teacher! Makes math fun and really knows her stuff. She loves to reference sports and makes the class environment conductive to learning. She goes out of her way to make notes and write them with the class instead of just reading off a powerpoint. Highly recommend this class!

Best lecturer I've had. She is always willing to help and makes the material as easy to understand as possible. She truly wants everyone to understand the material. She gives you notes to fill in during class- she is very transparent. Great class- if you get anything less than an B+ you probs didn't show up to lecture/lab. Txtbk not nec. but helps
Funny, lectures at a good pace, walks around a lot and walks up and down the aisles

Michelle was awesome. She was extremely organized and her examples made hard concepts in stats easy to understand. She prints notes for everyone and you fill them in with her in lecture. It makes it easy to know what is important. Homework and tests were not bad and there is a lot of extra credit offered.
I like her! She is really nice! If you work hard on this class, you will definitely get an A.

The class is poorly organized overall. No questions are allowed during tests, so if you're not sure what a question is asking, you aren't allowed to ask for clarification. Michelle is a good lecturer. Class notes are required and podcasts for every lecture are posted on Carmen. Pretty easy class except for the confusing wording of questions.

summary_comment: The professor's lectures are challenging to follow, with students reporting difficulty understanding about half of the content. One student found the approach effective only when combined with pre-lecture textbook reading, while another described the professor as arrogant and unhelpful, suggesting that class attendance is unnecessary and lectures are hard to comprehend due to an accent.

Ratings.comment: I did not understand the lectures about 50% of the time, but he seems like he wants to help. He usually asked for questions after each slide. The HWs and exams were fair but some questions felt like curveballs. The strat for this class: read the textbook reading in the syllabus before lecture days. This helps makes understanding lectures more easy

Very arrogant and not eager to help. Will give you smart a- answers and refuses to provide a study guide. Not passionate about teaching other than "read textbook". You're better off not going to class and learning from the textbook. His accent makes class lectures hard to understand.  Attendance not required and neither is his teaching.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and comprehensive coverage of material, though her classes are challenging with strict grading standards. Students find her notes clear and lectures well-organized, and she is known to be supportive and helpful. Despite the difficulty, many students appreciate her thoroughness and the significant amount they learn.

Ratings.comment: She is a wonderful professor and i loved her class a lot! I couldn't ask for anyone better for the regression class and I learned tons of things from her. Super helpful!
Her class is very hard and she is a very tough grader.  However, her notes are clear, her lectures organized, and she is always willing to help you out.
excellent prof.. learned tons
Her lectures cover the material well and are not too hard to follow but can be really boring.  She is a REALLY hard grader and I think that's why many people don't like her but she curves at the end.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his clear and engaging lectures, which effectively break down complex statistical concepts with practical examples. He maintains a good balance between challenging homework and fair tests that reflect classroom content. While some students note that attendance is mandatory and the professor can be inflexible about it, the overall consensus is positive, praising his ability to make statistics enjoyable and accessible.

Ratings.comment: He laid out all concepts very nicely & gave examples that helped explain them.  I was a non stat person & thought he did a great job in helping me understand everything.  HW took a long time and at times included things that weren't covered in class/explained in the book.  Tests reflected what we learned in class.  Overall, a good experience.

Excellent and entertaining lectures, professor uses good examples and always motivates concepts with intuition. Homeworks are usually somewhat challenging, but he gives you the tools in lecture. Also, he rides a bike everywhere.

Great professor who tries to make decision theory, Bayesian inference, and sequential analysis fun. Plus he lets you use cheat sheets on the exams. Take good notes, and 820 is an easy A. You should get at least a B even if you don't study. Only downside is that he does require attendance.

Achtung! Statistics does not have to be dry and boring! Doug Critchlow is a unbelievably good stats prof. with clear and well-organized lectures, interesting examples, and a great sense of humor. Extremely highly recommended!

A good teacher, but doesn't know how to be flexible. 3pts taken away each absent session. A guy added the class 3rd session and asked him if he was gonna be counted absent for 2nd session, he said: "yes, because you were not here, and I gotta keep the rule straight". And good sense of humor? The way he talks actually makes me very cranky in class.
Excellent professor.  One of the best statistics professors I have taken.  His examples are very applicable and helpful for the homework.  Tests are very reasonable.

summary_comment: The professor has mixed reviews, with some students finding his teaching style confusing and difficult to follow, while others appreciate his approachability and the potential to learn a lot if one works hard. Overall, his teaching quality is considered good, though his tendency to jump between topics and focus on sample problems from the book can be challenging. Despite these challenges, many students still find value in his classes and would consider taking another course with him.

Ratings.comment: His lecture style was almost like stream of consciousness writing.  He'd jump from topic to topic in a way that wasn't logical.  The content was mainly review for me which was helpful because I found he taught it in a way that was very confusing.  I wouldn't recommend taking classes from him. On a positive note, he did seem to be approachable.
very useful class, could learn a lot before taking harder stat classes

Did not enjoy this class.  My grade tanked when he didn't give us enough time to take the midterm exam. I knew my stuff, but I only had time to finish 2/3 of the exam. He teaches all by sample problems out of the book, and needs to spend more time explaining what we are actually learning before he dives into it. Says "idear" instead of "idea"
good teaching quality, and you could definitley learn a lot from him if you work really hard.
Kept things moving and interesting.  Great sense of humor, but a little on the dry side so you have to get used to it.  Definitely would take another class from him.

summary_comment: Professor Burch excels in teaching a challenging subject by effectively connecting theoretical concepts to real-world applications, making the material more relevant for future doctors. Students praise his clarity and willingness to assist, noting that while he expects effort, the learning experience is highly valuable.

Ratings.comment: I really having "Burch" as an instructor. He's teaching a subject that isn't the most exciting but he did a really good job connecting lessons back to the real world and things I will see as a future doctor.
Burch is an awesome TA. Presents everything clearly and always willing to help if anything isn't clear. Expects you to put in effort but it is well worth it in the end.

summary_comment: Dr. Miller is highly regarded by students for her engaging and flexible teaching style, though some find her lectures can be unclear and challenging. While her tests are rigorous and require significant effort, many praise her detailed handouts, willingness to record lectures, and ability to make complex topics accessible. Overall, her teaching is seen as excellent, with some students recommending her highly despite the workload.

Ratings.comment: She is unclear at times, and most of the time I found her lectures not very helpful. I would go to office hours, but somethings she could not clarify. The TA was not that helpful either. The tests can be challenging. Use another teacher or class through ITUNEsU or youtube.

Nice, funny & helpful. Promptly responded to emails with detailed answers. Able to attend class via Adobe Connect or watch lecture recordings later. Had to work decently hard to get an A, but it was possible! Midterms fair with tricky multiple choice and straight forward show-work problems. Allowed to use cheat sheets on tests! HIGHLY Recommend :)

I had never taken a statistics course in my life and was not sure what to expect when I first started the class. Dr. Miller is a wonderful professor, gives detailed handouts, exam reviews, and is pretty funny in lecture. One of the top professors I've had while at Ohio State.

I was very hesitant to take statistic due to the "hard" stereotype it has, but she is just an overall good professor in my opinion. Fair exams, funny lecturer, and lets you attend class online or in person.

Dr. Miller was a fantastic professor. She recorded her lectures and posts them on Carmen. She also live streamed her lectures and you could sit at home, listen to the lecture, watch the notes being written, and even ask questions for her to answer in the lecture hall. Very funny in lecturing and great person. You want to have Dr. Miller.

Didn't go to class much because she teaches straight from the book. When I did, lecture was very lively for an 8:30 class. Definitely a good choice if you have to take 245. Tests/h.w. are graded rather hard (she really cares about detail), but overall very fair. Must put in the work to get an A. Grade is made up of weekly hw, 2 midterms, and final
Dr. Miller has to be the best math professor in existence.  And I'm terrible at math, but breezed through the class.

Fantastic! An engaging, helpful, understanding, brilliant gem of a teacher. Flexible and understanding, smart and incredibly helpful, and to top it off, witty enough to make 8:30 lectures worthwhile... If you can take her section, jump at the chance! I've met her equals in teaching, but not her betters, and certainly not in the math departments.

Jokes, make the class more enjoyable. Idk what the kid below me was thinking. But Dr. Miller is genuinely interested in teaching. Stats 145 is easy, and she makes it easier. Very lenient grading, and will give points back if you prove your case. obtained 4 points back on exam, just by explaining my thought process, even though answer was wrong =]
telling jokes throughout class doesnt actually make students understand concepts. at all.
Dr. Miller was very interested in the material, and it seemed that she really wanted the students to learn. She made the class interesting, and I learned a lot!
Amazing professor. She loves teaching statistics and is extremely helpful.

Great Professor, she throughly enjoys teaching and you cal tell. Is always willing to help students, and encourages you to seek help if you need it. Also make statistics, normally a boring subject manageable and interesting. Highly recommend taking stats with her one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State.

Dr. Miller is awesome. She's approachable, easy going and seems to actually care about teaching. Class wasn't super interesting all the time, but she made lecture less monotonous than it could've been. Go to lecture and recitation and definitely do the online hw it really helps prepare for the quizzes and tests.

Dr.miller is a wonderful instructor if you need anything she we help you and she understands most people taking the class don't want to be there. She listens to students and she is very approachable. She really enjoys teaching and its obvious. She makes statistics as interesting as possible. I'd highly recommend her.

Dr. Miller does an excellent job of making a boring class interesting.  She uses jokes and various class polls to try to excite us, but at 8:30 am in a stats class, this is almost impossible to do.  Regardless, she is one of the best lecturers I've ever had.

Dr. Miller is a really good prof. The only thing I had a problem with were the stories she told during class distracted me and made me want to sleep every morning in my 8:30am lecture. Her exams were a little tough; the questions seemed to be irrelevant to what was taught in class. Do your work and attend lectures and recitation.
She gets a bit off track and talks about her personal life a bit too much.  It may seem funny, but shes not the one that has to get a good grade.  I learned more in the recitations.

Dr. Miller is the best professor for intro to Stat at OSU. When i entered Stat 245, I had no prior knowledge of what Stat was, and after i left her class, I was so interested in Statistics that in my econometrics classes, i ended up doing very well to the point that it's become my favorite class as I pursue my Ph.D in Economics. Thanks Dr. Miller.

Dr. Miller is SUCH a nice lady and actually makes statistics interesting and fun (if that's even possible). Highly recommended for Stat 145. Go to class, fill in the notes, do the homework, and an A is no problem. She makes herself very available for questions and concerns and is genuinely interested in helping students. AWESOME TEACHER!

I've never commented on this site before, but Dr. Miller is so great that I just HAD to.  She is such an awesome teacher, and she seems to be an even cooler person.  I wish I could have class with her every quarter.  I highly recommend her.  She's the kind of teacher that you want to be friends with.  Class is organized well and tests are fair.
BEST professor so far!! She is very clear and makes her lectures fun! Exams are very fair!! Highly Recommended!

JACKIE IS AWESOME! go to class, stay awake, ask a question every once in a while, make sure she knows your name, and you'll do great. find the online resources she uses in class and mess around with them in your spare time, a lot of stuff with make a lot of sense that way. DO THE HWS THAT AREN'T REQUIRED!!! final bonus qs announced in class
Awesome professor!! She made the class very easy and exams are fair. I would highly recommend her!
She's the BEST professor I've had so far!!!! Highly recommended!!!!

Overall an easy class. She breaks the material down really well so that people can understand it. She lightens things up with stories, which can be entertaining and it buys time so you don't fall asleep. My only complaint about the class is like every other math class, always seems like they pick the most obscure problems to put on tests.
Incredible teacher, very funny, very fair. Definitely take her.

Dr. Miller is simply a great professor. She made stats understandable for someone who has always struggled with math. I like how she relates concepts to real-world situations. She is very passionate about her job and it really shows. She also has a great personality, which kept me engaged in the lecture. If you have to take 145 definitely take her!

Dr. Miller is really passionate about teaching and stat, and her enthusiasm made this class bearable. Her notes consisted of filling blanks into a Uniprint note packet, so I found it hard to pay attention, except to fill in those blanks. She lets you make cheat sheets for exams, which is really good. Exams are fair.

She is a pretty good teacher that understands that we aren't stat majors and that we HAVE to take this class. She wastes a little too much time in class talking about stuff that doesn't really matter. she gives pretty fair exams so if you're gonna take this stats, you should do it with her.
Jackie was a very nice and helpful teacher, although I personally found it hard to pay attention in class, and fell very behind as the quarter went on. Make sure you stay up with the homework!
I loved her class! She made it easy to follow along in lecture and she communicated the information very well! She has a great personality and makes class fun! Take Stat 145 with her!
Awesome teacher and a lot of help. Very funny and makes Stats interesting! Highly recommend her.
Her class is fun, but she fails to make the subject clear.  Tests are ridiculous.

Dr. Miller tried to make class interesting and fun at 8:30 am. Class consists of copying notes straight off the slides, so it's easy to not pay attention. She's willing to help and answer questions and is really personable. She would joke and talk to the people she knew. I found it a little difficult to get an A.
She was nice and tried to make class interesting unfortunatly stats is really boring.
Jackie is a great professor, she tried her best to make the class fun.  The material is difficult but she was helpful which made up the difference. Great personality too!
Before I took stats I had absolutely no intrest in the class, but Dr. Miller really made learning stats interesting. The clarity of her lectures are amazing. I would recommend her to anyone.

Don't take stats thinking it will be an easy A... you'll have to do a lot of work...but she is the best one to take if you MUST take this class for your major.  Attendance in recitation was mandatory but not in lecture.

EXCELLENT professor.  She truly makes the class fun and interesting by making the material easy to understand, and she tells funny stories randomly.  I didn't think I would enjoy this statistics class, but lecture was more than tolerable because of Dr. Miller. I highly recommend her

This class was kinda confusing.. but it wasn't the teachers fault, stats is just a little tricky. She made it as clear as possible. Her exams were fair.. study and you should do okay! She lets you make cheat sheets for the exams also!

Very, Very clear prof. Stats can be most uninteresting at times, but she makes the subject take life. This was her first time teaching 245, and she did a very, very good job of it. I strongly suggest taking her if you have the opportunity.

Great Prof, very funny! I also had an excellent TA (take Jerry Butler if you can!). Missing class every once in a while isn't a big deal because she posts the notes online later and you cover it again in recitation.

What a great teacher! She is funny, smart and she speaks English! (English speaking teachers are hard to find at this school) Stat 145 is incredibly confusing at times but she is very helpful and very entertaining. If she hadn't been so friendly and helpful, I would have dropped the class. She is great but beware, some of her TAs are terrible!
She makes statistics fun
she seemed not overly interested in teaching this course
She is such a good teacher.  She is funny, very helpful, and does her best to make a subject that many do not normally find interesting to be a painless as possible.  Highly suggest her class.

Jackie Miller was a great stats professor. She made class fun and liked to tell jokes...which made the class entertaining. She knows the material well because you use a book for notes during lecture that she has created herself. Exams aren't hard becaue you are aloud to create a cheat sheet!!!

Very fun professor. She lets you use cheat sheets on all quizzes and exams. She's entertaining in class. I had it at a good time of day, so it wasn't too hard to make it to class, but I never dreaded it. Good TA's too. Everyone is very excited about stats lol

I LOVE this professor!!  Best math professor ever.  She really cares about her students, and her lectures are not only interesting (tough to do with the material) but incredibly entertaining, because of her little side jokes and funny stories.  She is one of the few professors I have gotten to know at Ohio State.  A really fantastic lady.
The material is terrible but she is a good professor. She will help you with everything you need in this class and she tries to make the class interesting.

I've never had a good math prof here...but Dr. Miller is my 1st!  She's great, she's interested in teaching, loves students, and has good TA's!  Work hard, be serious about it, and you can def. get a B at least.  DO THE HOMEWORK!
best prof. i've had in 4 years at OSU.  I HATE math, and was dreading stats (damn GEC's) - She made me LOVE class - I never missed one - she's awesome - if you are taking stats - TAKE HER ONLY!!!
She was awesome and a really great professor. She was really funny and told little stories and made comments in every class. We could use cheat sheets on every exam and quiz too.
really nice lady

Dr. Miller is a good teacher. Makes jokes about Stats. Made class interesting. Can use cheat sheets for quizzes & tests and she even raps the last day. Our last day of class she said "once your teacher always your teacher, if you ever need anything let me know". I have been at OSU for 3 years & have never had a teacher say that. Highly Recommended!
Best. Professor. Ever.  Makes what could be an exceedingly dry subject not only interesting but fun.  I actually look forward to lecture.
Prof. Miller was fabulous inside the classroom and made this mathaphobic actually understand stats. She was also great during office hours and went out of her way for students.
Stats is not an enjoyable topic, but Dr. Miller makes it about as good as a teacher could.  She is very enthusiastic about her teaching, and reasonably funny.  I recommend it.
Best math teacher ever!!!!

She was an excellent prof.  She's very enthusiastic about what she does and is more then willing to help.  Homework is easy way to bring up grade and quizzes and midterms are very forward (no tricks here!)  Highly recommended for those that aren't great at math.

Dr. Miller is an awesome prof...she makes stats (which can be really boring) an interesting class and is willing to work with you and goes out of her way to answer any questions or address any problems you have.
she makes jokes about statistics, if a teacher can do that, she is good
Very good professor! she makes it very fun and easy to take notes. midterm and quizzes are easy and you can use cheat sheets!
She is the best professor I have ever had.  She makes learning easy and her pre-made course packets make taking notes (and learning) a breeze!

Entertaining prof. Makes lectures interesting. Tests are reasonable, mult choice and a few problems you work out on your own. Can use a page of notes for midterm and 2 pages for final. Labs in recitation are boring and pointless but can bring up grade.
Excellent Teacher. Exams + Homework are of reasonable difficulty and she makes light of a dry subject.  Definitly would take again.
Gr8 teacher, funny sometimes, overall doesnt let u get bored in the class!
genuinely interested in helping students.
No Comments

Very funny. Mixes the material in with practical applications. Setup is very matter of fact. Allows note cards on midterms and exams. No late homework at all. Recommended, especially if you have a hard time grasping math in the first place.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor has mixed reviews; while some students found the class helpful and clear, others described the teaching as poor and unhelpful, with one student finding the instructor difficult to approach and lacking in knowledge. Overall, the teaching quality appears inconsistent, with significant differences in student perceptions.

Ratings.comment: good class
Absolutely awful. The least helpful teacher I have ever had. I ended up getting a B but I still thought he was horrendous.
Great class.  Kind of monotone, but very clear.
Always very helpful, and the reiteration of big ideas from lecture helped clear a lot of things up.
Had no clue how to teach Stats. He would get mad if anybody was confused and asked a question. He's not even a nice guy.
Did not seem to know what he was talking about. Also did not care to help anybody.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for delivering an outstanding class, characterized by clear explanations and engaging content, which consistently receives positive feedback from students.

Ratings.comment: Awesome class and professor!

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as knowledgeable but ineffective in her teaching methods. Students find her classes challenging and frustrating due to her heavy emphasis on theory and lack of practical application, coupled with exams that do not reflect the material covered in class. Her refusal to curve grades, despite low average scores, and inconsistent attendance during office hours further contribute to the negative perception of her teaching.

Ratings.comment: She seems to know her stuff but can't teach it.

This class was extremely hard and she refused to curve the class despite terribly low averages. Had to go to the stats department chair to get the final exam curved for the class. Tayler is really hot tho ;). I would still say avoid her though.

She teaches as if stats is second nature to people, and uses it as a platform to preach that we have to suck it up and put in the effort. Which would be fine if not for everyone struggling. She is stubborn in her teaching method which is heavy on theory but very sparse on application. I true pain of a course, she is only a grad student after all.

homeworks were do able, but the second half of semester, the homework was all proofs as though we were stat majors.  exams were no reflection of the material taught in class, done on the homework, or the practice exams.  seems to be like all proofs and variables, came from left field.  avoid taking this class with her.

She often doesn't attend her own office hours, she tests as if we were Stat majors, as opposed to engineering, she blames us for not understanding material, yet takes class time to show us instagrams of her cat. Exams are impossible (avg ~55) and she doesn't curve. DOESN'T CURVE! Avoid this teacher at all costs!

Does not teach the material well then complains how "we" the students are not putting enough effort to pass her impossible exams. Refuses to curve since it is somehow our fault that the average was a 53%. Avoid her

Teaches the class as if statistics is the easiest thing in the world then gives extremely difficult exams.  Teaches technicalities and then tests over understanding.  Homework does not prepare you for exams.

Most of her notes for the first half didn't follow our class. Sometimes gave us a homework very late on sunday night to work on that was due friday during the midterm day. Gave us no time to really focus on the midterm. The exams so far were just like the previous person said coming from the left field. Not what was expected. Don't take her..

Be careful in this class.  The lecturer likes to rant on tangents.  So the day's lesson can get incredibly cloudy fast.  You will need to self-teach with the aid of the book.  Homework is hard.  You will need a solid 8 hrs to complete each week.  Worst part is that her exams come from left field and no one finishes them.

Clear voice.  Good lectures, well explained complex statistics subjects.  Going to lectures was actually worth the hour it took, for once:   One hour lecture was equal to studying same section for 1.5 hrs from book.
Sharp, intelligent, well-organized, and to the point. Also probably the hottest instructor I've ever had--she rocks a pair of jeans.
soo hot
Tayler was a great prof. Explained things very clearly, was very helpful and very approachable. Loved her!
Tayler tends to speak quickly, but is knowledgable and helpful when you need it. She is also way hot, which has nothing to do with Stats, but helps attendance, I'm sure.
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being extremely clear and organized, and for providing in-depth explanations of practice problems. Students appreciate his availability for help and find his lectures engaging, even when the subject matter is typically dry. His approachable and sometimes humorous demeanor makes the class more enjoyable, leading many to recommend taking his course.

Ratings.comment: Geez... I've been watching his YouTube videos, and I'm jealous that I couldn't have had him for a lecturer. He's extremely clear and organized with his presentation of the material and he often goes into depth on each of the practice problems rather than just writing random things down.

I had him for an 8AM and he made it a lot less bad then it could have been. I'd say its a good idea to show up to MOST lectures (1 or 2 a week of 3) because the equations are there and you will use them for the hw's. Homeworks were not hard, and if you ask him questions before, during or after class he will give you so much help. I'd take it again.
I dropped the class but he was a good lecturer. And he's really cute.

couldnt have asked for a better lecturer, hes very clear, funny, and will answer any question.  This whole Stats team is excellent and im very pleased with all that ive learned.  I even switched my minor to statistics, after enjoying this class so much.
Stats is boring, but Mark is cute! So going to class at 8 in the morning wasn't as much of a pain as I would normally consider it!

summary_comment: The professor has significant issues with English proficiency, making lectures challenging and hindering learning. Students found it necessary to rely on external resources such as textbooks and recitations to grasp the material. Given these challenges, many would not recommend taking the class with this professor.

Ratings.comment: Her English wasn't really good and stats is already a very hard class to take. Make sure you get a tutor if you have her as a professor.

Professor has poor English skills, which make lectures very difficult to understand/learn from. I learned everything in this class online in the textbook and from my recitations. Would not recommend taking with this professor at all.

summary_comment: Sean is a dedicated and caring professor who often receives praise for his engaging lectures and commitment to student success, though some students find his pacing too fast and his lectures challenging to follow. His ability to explain concepts clearly and his willingness to accommodate students facing difficulties are notable strengths. Overall, while there are mixed opinions on his organization and the workload, many students appreciate his support and genuine interest in their learning.

Ratings.comment: This class was a living torture, I learned absolutely nothing. Skip the lectures and watch Deborah Rumseys lecture videos instead. Sean rushes through the material, didn't even know when we had exams and would always show up unprepared. The recitation assignments in that class take an excruciating amount of time, and overall had miserable time.

pretty good at explaining things but he was kind of disorganized. I stopped going to lecture after 3 weeks & ended up watching the videos by deb Ramsey on canvas bc it was easier to learn and absorb the material. the lectures moved at a very quick pace and the tests were difficult, however the class content itself was not harder than calculus.
He's a good lecturer even sometimes he doesn't prepare well for his lectures. However, he explained well with clear examples and evidence.

I took O'Neill's class during a 2020 summer session at CState. Sean is an understanding professor. If you are struggling with something or have complications at home, he will do his best to accommodate you. That being said, his recorded lectures are hard to follow and he gives large amounts of homework. I mostly learned from the textbook and Khan.
Great lecturer and helps anyone who need help in stats. He does not make the exams, but he prepares you for them very well.

Sean is a really great lecturer when compared to the other options. He tries to be engaging and he really makes sure you understand where all the numbers he is using are coming from. I feel like for 1430 he is the lecturer who gives you the best shot at an A.

Sean seems like a klutz at first, but turned out to be one of my favorite professors. Sometimes has trouble with the computer, but otherwise he is great choice. Cares a lot about his students and often tries to get to them as the year goes on. Can't say that for most professors.

Ignore the bad comments. Sean is one of the most caring, helpful and wonderful professors I have ever had in MAth/STAT. He's an authentic and genuinely down to earth. I had health issues thought out the semester, but he helped me get caught up and he always wants his students to succeed. He's also a genius in math, take him and you won't regret
He is the worst professor Ive ever had. He is never prepared for class and cannot explain topics he is teaching

Sean O'Neill is the worst professor I have ever seen. He has no idea what he is talking about and cannot figure out his computer. Lectures are pointless and I cannot follow him. Offered no support whatsoever and just seemed like he did not care. Avoid and take with a professor that actually cares about teaching and students
I thought he was pretty good and helpful, though his battle with the computer could be distracting.

Sean isn't the main lecturer so he has no say in the tests. Half the time he doesnt know what is going to be on the test. He always seems confused and most of the time his lectures are no help. take the other professor for this class.

Laid back, laughs at his own jokes. Seemed a little ambivalent (for example, not knowing what was going on in recitation), but it was hard to tell if that wasn't a ruse/joke of its own. The course coordinator, Professor Everson, was very helpful as a supplement and the "required" textbook is completely unnecessary if you take notes in recitation.

This class was super easy, and Sean was a really good lecturer. GO TO CLASS, you'll get up to 10 points of extra credit just for showing up. Sean was funny, laid back, knew what he was talking about, but not particularly special or approachable. Allowed a cheat sheet on the exam, homework every week, but it's not bad at all.

He is super laid back and really funny sometimes. Beginning of the class is super easy. Gets a little harder after the first midterm, but not bad. 10 question homework due every Sunday. Labs every week. 2 exams, get a cheatsheet for both. Lots of extra credit opportunities. You literally get extra credit on top hat just for going to class.
Really easy class and and really layer back teacher.

This class was  a joke. You get a cheat sheet on your exams and can put anything on it--everything in the lectures is all you need. You just need to do the HW for points and follow the formulas on the lecture slides on the test. I think I got a 99 something without even trying. He makes what you need to know crystal clear. Only need book for HW.
After the first exam I had a 50%... started going to office hours and ended with an A-!!! Amazing prof

THIS GUY IS THE BEES KNEES.  I will give you the key to success:  Eat breathe and sleep the practice problems he gives you near exam time and you will get an A. Homework is a lot more difficult than what can be expected on exams but he drops two.

Exams were alright. Just follow his examples and study his reviews and you'll be fine. HW can be a little difficult at times but there's not that much he assigns. Overall his class was a challenging since I was falling behind, but I managed to catch up.
Very easy exams. Literary study 2 days before the exam and you will get more than 90. The class average is around 85. Super easy tests and no HW load
Took Math 1152 with him. Great prof, take it with him if at all possible.
easy

The best prof I've yet to have in college. He is great at explaining and the class is very fair. More than anything, he is an extremely chill guy... the kind of dude I'd want to chill with outside of class. We had snack days in class, and one day my buddy brought chocolate milk for the entire class. Prof O'Neill made a 3 hour class enjoyable

You'll be fine as long as you do the homework assignments (exams draw heavily from these) and make a decent cheat sheet for the exams.  Lectures are recommended to stay on track, especially toward the end, but skipping a few isn't a big deal. Homework is easy and helpful for exams. Grading is very fair.
Sean's a cool guy. Lectures are short. There were 6 homeworks (two or three questions each) and he drops the 2 lowest. And he allows an 8 12 by 11 cheat sheet on all the exams.

summary_comment: Nicholas is highly regarded as an exceptional lecturer and teaching assistant, with students praising his clear explanations and superior clarity compared to other instructors like Dr. Rumsey. Many consider him the best professor or TA they have encountered, noting that his conceptual approach to exams and detailed slide materials are key to success in the course.

Ratings.comment: Nicholas was great! His lectures were amazing and much clearer than Dr. Rumsey.
Best professor I ever had

Nick is a TA not a professor, but he is the greatest TA I have ever had. If I did not have him as my recitation leader I would not be doing this well in stats 1430. His explanations are better than Dr. Rumsey's. Also for exams it is very conceptual not a lot of calculations at all. Do not study the recitations study the slides she gives.

summary_comment: Professor Jones' class is largely taught by her TA, with minimal input from her during regular sessions. While the class is relatively easy with basic content and ample extra credit, success heavily depends on self-study and performing well on two critical exams. The class structure and grading can be challenging, with low average scores and no curve, making it a demanding option for students.

Ratings.comment: What you need to know about Professor Jones' class is that she doesn't teach it. It's 99% taught by her TA with the 1% being pre-exam study sessions she hosts. Professor Jones' is very nice but I literally learn nothing in her class because her TA's just talk AT you instead of teaching. You will need to teach yourself all of the material.

Relatively easy class if you put in some effort. Basic math that you barely even have to do b/c of the ti-84 stat function. Lots of extra credit assignments.

The 2 exams will make or break your grade, do not neglect studying for those.

Professor was super nice and easy to reach out to. Very understanding with deadlines if you had valid excuse.

This is your only option for stats. People that aren't good at math will more than likely fail. You can't get help at the math lab. How this class is ran as an online class is stressful. So many teachers and TA's.
She conveyed material by just talking it through to herself without explaining it to students. Your grade almost solely relies on your exam performance.

Relatively easy online course. Learn to use stat functions on a calculator, it's so much easier than calculating by hand. Long lectures and around a 15-question homework due almost every Friday with unlimited attempts. Recitation attendance is required. Use your TAs.

Professor Jones is not as terrible as people try to paint her. She does give tons of HW, quizzes, and her exams are often harder than the questions we practice. Her lecture videos are little to no help so I often looked for outside resources to teach me. My advice if you take her stats class is to utilize her office hours! Overall decent

Not sure whether there are any other professors teaching this online during the summer but if so, please take this course with them. The TA told us duing our last reciation that prof. Jones would curve our grade but she didn't. The class average 58.5% and I'm sure barely ayone actually passed her class.

I took this as a virtual class because that was the only option. It contained lots of homework, quizzes, and tests. The tests were very hard with averages being 60% and 59% on a midterm and a final and she refused to curve which was very disappointing. It was very hard for an entry-level STATs class.

This class is a 3 credit hour class, however I spent a lot of time outside of class trying to understand the material. The lectures were straighforward, however the exams were a lot harder. There are homeworks every week and are typically hard and take a long time to complete. Overall, this class was difficult for a intro level stats class.
She makes simple things extremely complicated.

This was not a bad class at all. I do have to say though, since class was online, you had to copy notes from an pre-made lecture that was sometimes hard to follow. The tests being online were very tricky because the only way to get points was to write out each step taken to get the answer to the problem. There is a couple extra credit options!

I really likes Professor Jones. She was caring towards her students, however with the Stats department there wasn't much she could do. This online class was very hard. The exams are worth 65% of your grade, even though HW and Quizzes are worth more point wise, it won't help you that much. I got A's on all HW and Quizzes and failed all exams. C-

This course was good! Ive never been super great at math, but this course was a do it at your own pace". I found this to be really helpful. There were lots of PowerPoints, but they weren't too bad. Any questions that I had were quickly answered by both Jones and the TAs in a way that made it easier to understand. I would definitely recommend!

I absolutely hate stats, science, math, really any class with numbers. Considering that, Laura was great. The course definitely makes you work for it and it is A LOT of reading PowerPoint slides. However, the TAs are always available and Laura responds very fast. Everyone is very understanding and genuinely wanted you to do well.
I took this class online so the lectures were pre-recorded and uploaded - it was easy to fall behind! but Prof. Jones was so nice and helpful during the office hours

Online class, posted powerpoints with audio attached. Clear lectures, but lots of little assignments to keep track of. Easy class if you need it as a GE or a prerequisite, definitely doable online. TAs are very accessible. But actually pay attention and do homework, exams are worth a big portion of the grade.
Professor Blackburn, JD. is a wise elder, but this course is difficult and boring.
Its not a good choice. Take it somewhere else!
She is very boring .

She made me doubt about myself whether I'm good at statistics, and made me nearly give up. However, I even did better in the advanced statistics course, which proves that it's not my fault and it's her fault.
Do not choose it!
It course is so tm difficult!
Although she is not a professor, she is a good lecturer. She is young and simple, but not naive. She often shares her life experience. I really like her.
She is moderate, which is not excellent but not bad. I commented here before but my comment was deleted by this website. This is 21th century! How could this be happened? !

Laura is my favorite professor that I ever met in this university. Her lecture is so systematical and you just need to listen and take note of her good blackboard writing notes and do the review. She also have extra credit for someone who points out her mistakes in class.

She is an enthusiastic lecturer. She really cares about the material and how the students perform. While she doesn't just hand you points, she definitely provides a lot of information on how one can do well in the class. I'm glad I won't have to take another stats class, but I wouldn't mind taking more if she were the instructor.

Laura is hands down the best professor I've had in college. I'm taking her course as a retake and can finally understand the material because of her clear lectures and help. She genuinely wants to make sure students understand the material. HIGHLY recommend
