summary_comment: Professor MacEachern excels in making complex statistical concepts engaging and understandable, thanks to his charisma and detailed explanations. While students find his material challenging, they appreciate his care for their learning and availability. His lectures on quality control are particularly praised for their ability to make the subject matter fascinating.

Ratings.comment: Makes statistics as interesting as it could be. He is charismatic, kind, and cares a lot about his students. Explains difficult concepts very clearly and in detail. Homework and exams are tricky but exams are curved.

Professor MacEachern knows his stuff and more importantly he cares about his students. I felt he was very available. He can be disorganized - it is especially challenging when there is no textbook to fall back on.
MacEachern made quality control way more interesting than expected.

summary_comment: Professor Sadeghkhani's teaching is generally considered challenging and confusing, with lectures moving quickly and assuming prior knowledge from 3201. While he is accessible outside of class and provides useful practice materials, many students find his lectures hard to follow and the testing format harsh, with questions often being all-or-nothing. Despite these challenges, some students appreciate his clear explanations of formulas and the similarity between practice exams and actual tests.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are confusing -- goes fast and assumes you remember everything from 3201. Lots of test/assignment questions are all or nothing. Accessible outside of class, but going to office hours didn't really help, was sort of condescending. His saving grace is that there is very little HW, and the exams are very similar to the practice exams.

His average is about 50, and it's very tough. He doesn't provide adequate information, and it's heavily self-motivated in terms of looking for resources. If you are in his session, don't hesitate, run as fast as possible.

Professor Sadeghkhani was a very kind professor, who was empathetic to students. He was always willing to help with grading and answer questions about homework and quizzes. Although he may not have had the most clear lectures, he was normally happy to answer questions. The class was graded primarily by midterms and homework, which were few.

Lectures were boring and difficult to engage with, it was also unclear which material was important for exams or future lectures. However, he provides plenty of review materials and practice questions for the exams which were helpful. If you are capable of learning/understanding material by yourself, you will probably do well enough in this class.

This class is based on 5 HWs and 3 exams, so every point matters. Most exams rely on just using the correct formula that he gives in lectures. His lectures are good and make it clear to know which formulas to use when, and I felt that I understood a great deal from his teaching. His practice material is also good, which helps to reinforce learning
Denied extra test time to disabled students.

REVIEW FOR 3202: Assumes everything is common sense. Talks a bunch but doesn't write down anything on the board. I also got screwed over with a grade and he wouldn't change it even after I pointed out the mistake.

3202 REVIEW! - Leaving review early for people scheduling next semester - avoid if you can. Smart guy but thinks everything is common sense. Goes very fast with minimal explanation, basically just does example problems whole lecture. Assumes you remember EVERYTHING from 3201. Accessible outside of class, but going to office hours didn't help at all
Did not learn anything at all. Asked him at the beginning of the semester about the success rate in his class, and he said it more more than normal for half the class to fail his class.
Nice professor. Really enjoyed taking his class. After following his notes and suggestions, I passed the exam with a B+. Always nice with everyone and his office hours were useful.
He was well organized and explained the materials quite well. His exams were a bit hard but at the end of the semester you feel you have learned something!

Awful. He did not explain lectures well at all. He claimed that he made the easiest midterm of his life which had an average of 14/25. The homework doesn't help your understanding much at all. I only got an A because I watched youtube videos from previous engineering stats professors who actually taught the material.

I genuinely don't understand why anyone's giving this guy good reviews; he's one of the worst professors I've had. His lecture notes are so unorganized and hardly legible. I went to all the lectures and still had to teach myself everything prior to exams. Just be sure you have really good cheat sheets for the exams and you'll be fine in this class.

His teaching is not that direct and you have to study yourself. However, do not bother if you don't understand some stuff because what matters is just the formula and how to use it. If you don't understand the derivation, don't sweat it because you will only need the derived one. His homework is like not abundant and you can enjoy your weekend.

Dropped the class at the recommendation of my advisor because the professor refused to accommodate my disability. The lectures I went to before dropping were hard to follow and he often made mistakes. Midterm averages ended up being around 50%, so I'm not sure I would have passed anyway.
Always available to help and caring about his students. Exams are hard, but if you follow his lectures you can make it.

I am in shock there are any positive reviews from other students. This is the worst professor I have ever had. I understand this is a difficult class overall, but our exam averages have been 50-60 percent, with tough grading. Lectures and example problems are messy and mistake-ridden. In my experience unhelpful outside of class. Avoid at all costs.

This is an extremely difficult and unreasonably stressful class. It is only a 3 credit hour course and I end up studying for it more than any of my other classes. There is no reason for it to be this hard.

I like his teaching style. He uses his iPad and he fills out the notes in the class and he posts the annotations. 
He's standards are a bit high, but sometimes the graders of the course are harsh. He takes care of each his student. You'll love statistics ( maybe lol) after this course.
Responsive and nice.
(Review for STAT 3470) Avoid this professor! Lectures are confusing and messy, midterms contain material not covered in class, and he refuses to accommodate students with disabilities.
STAT 3470. I like his teaching skills. He is keen and responsive. Highly recommend taking this course with him.

This review is actually for STATS 3470 but the class doesn't show up so it is under this class. But anyways, he is a pretty awful professor for STATS 3470. He goes through the content without explaining very well, doesn't answer questions well, is very boring, and gets a lot of examples wrong in class. If you don't have to take this class, DON'T.
Excellent!!!

The group project is graded generously, which is nice for a STEM course. Exams feel pretty difficult but I suspect he curved our final & maybe Midterm 2. He always provides practice exams, which is really nice. Sometimes he goes faster than you can write, but he posts annotated notes after lecture. If you pay attention in class you should do fine.

SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Statistical Inference for Data Analytics

summary_comment: The professor's first-time experience teaching a large lecture was evident in her nervousness and frequent mistakes during lectures, which affected clarity. Grading was heavily weighted towards a single midterm and final exam, but students who practiced recitation problems and used the practice exams on Carmen performed well.

Ratings.comment: It was her first time teaching a large lecture and you could tell she was nervous. Made lots of mistakes during lecture and didn't explain things clearly. Grades weighed heavily on one midterm and one final. If you practice the recitation problems and do the practice midterm/final on Carmen you will be fine

summary_comment: Professor Matt Brehms is highly regarded for his exceptional knowledge and engaging teaching style, making complex statistical concepts accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate his availability and willingness to help, though they note that success requires significant effort, particularly with challenging tests and quizzes. His lectures are praised for being both informative and entertaining, even at early morning hours.

Ratings.comment: Very smart, approachable, and helpful, he will do anything to help a student. However the tests and quizzes are still tough and you need to put in the work to do well, just going to lecture will not get you far at all.

Matt is the kind of lecturer that makes you excited to learn, even if it's about Stats. His enthusiasm and intelligence are apparent when you hear him speak; it is obvious he knows what he's talking about. He is a great resource and goes out of his way to make himself available to all 300 or so of his students. He's funny too.

I am so so glad I had Matt as a lecturer and a TA, he made stats almost enjoyable and so clear. Lectures are not necessary as long as you watch the online podcasts. The mandatory recitation attendance and no cell phones is a universal rule for stats but he does enforce it. He was really funny and I strongly encourage him as a TA and lecturer!

Matt Brehms is hands down the best professor I have ever had in college. While his lectures are at 8 a.m., Matt makes them worthwhile and entertaining. The subject matter can be difficult at times (make sure you know integrals - rational functions, exponential, singularity) but Matt will break down the material and give many helpful tips.
Matt is the man! Definitely a guy that knows his stuff and can easily teach it to his students in a manner they can understand.

Matt was a really helpful TA. He responded to emails right away, answered questions well, and had good examples to explain concepts. He made stats recitation fun. It was obvious that he cared about us doing well in class and as people.

summary_comment: The professor is highly intelligent and approachable, effectively supporting students in Stat 1430. However, lectures are crucial as the material is challenging, with tests and quizzes being particularly difficult, necessitating diligent study. Notable resources like a textbook or homework are not provided, emphasizing the importance of consistent self-study.

Ratings.comment: She was my Stat 1430 TA. Very smart, approachable, and helpful. You must attend lecture. Regardless the tests and quizzes were very hard and you really have to work to get a good grade. There is no book or homework so you must keep up on the studying.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining lectures, which are complemented by humorous jokes. Students find his classes enjoyable and effective, with manageable weekly homework and quizzes. He is recommended for those seeking an easy A.

Ratings.comment: Lecture is fun; slides is fun; and the professor is fun!!!
Good professor, full of cheesy jokes.
Lectures are fun and he keeps you engaged. There are weekly online homework and quizzes due which take no more than 30 mins to complete. If you need an easy A I recommend this class with Tim!

summary_comment: Professor Pearl is widely regarded as challenging and difficult, with students citing harsh exam grading, confusing lectures, and a lack of meaningful interaction or support. Exams are heavily weighted, and many find the material and exams to be more comprehensive than what was covered in class. Some students, however, found his lectures engaging and useful for understanding the course content.

Ratings.comment: When he asks if anybody has any questions, he waits about 2 seconds then continues.  All students in my class complain about no help, being confused, and nothing making sense.  The examples he has on reviews for exams are the same examples he used in previous lectures. Exams are biggest majority of the grade, pass the exams you will pass the class.

I would would not recommend Prof Pearl. He graded the exams harshly, they were too long, and in my opinion too difficult. He would try to explain the concept for ten minutes then rush through the example, and that made things hard to understand. Avoid him if you can, but if you can't be prepared to study hard.

Dr. Pearl was ridiculously difficult.  He was my lecturer.  Silly me, thought that by choosing him as my lecturer that somehow it would be easier to understand.  NOT...After midterm and final, I felt I did well and was shocked by my grade...hmmm...

I never saw the guy! The lecturer I had was so disinterested that she would sigh every few minutes. Dr. Pearl was supposed give us a review but the lecturer said he was out of town, again! The exams were hard and we didn't even cover the material in class-lecture or lab. The lab is a joke - and the person that taught that was so disinterested!
His midterms and finals are very unrelated to the practice exams he gave. He makes his test more comprehension than actually doing math.
Dr. Pearl doesn't lecture, he is the course coordinator. This class is ridiculously easy, though.

Dennis doesn't even teach this class. I've never seen him before in my life, and I'm sure if I was walking around, I wouldn't even be able to point him out. It's really quite sad. My lecturer is good, though. I would just like to see the person who handles my grades. So, if you like face-to-face contact with your professors, don't take this class.

He is genuinely interested in conveying the course information and gist. Lectures were interesting and helped for the most part. He is a statistics professor but uses that terminology sparingly. I would recommend the professor to anyone.

Granted I only saw him at lecture but I felt that if I did not understand something he would be helpful at his office hours. He seemed to care about the understanding of the material and seemed to want to keep the lectures as interesting as statistics could be.
Explains things very clearly.
Oversees the Dept and has TA's lecture and do labs he does final review. Writes the exams and his wording on the all exams are very tricky!
No Comments
Class is really boring but if you miss even one, like i did, you will fall behind. as long as you keep up with the material its easy. professor is interested in teaching and knows his stuff.

Very boring stupid class, but go to class or you'll fall behind. Not hard at all, just annoying. It's pretty nice he hands out notes at the beginning of every class and you fill in stuff throughout lectures. If you miss a class, he brings them just to the next one

I really liked Dr. Pearl.  He's pretty monotone, and the lectures were boring, but all the notes were online ahead of time and where the "fill in the blank" kind.  The labs really helped and mt TA, sumayyah, was very informative.
The lectures were cool, but the labs and the TAs all suck. If you miss a class, you get way behind.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and approachable nature. Students find his lectures engaging, with clear notes and helpful review sessions. While some note the class can be challenging with hard tests, overall, students appreciate his willingness to assist and recommend him strongly for statistics courses.

Ratings.comment: Ok, this guys is GREAT. Very funny!! I highly recommend him. His notes are crystal clear and the class itself is extremely easy if you just go to lecture and do the homework. There is really no reason anyone could fail this class, honestly.
Michael's a good teacher. Make sure to go to lecture, attendence is taken 6 times and counts, hard tests, but you'll get a good grade as long as you do homework and go to labs.
Not a very difficult class. Mike's review sessions were helpful.
great guy will help anyone, breaks it down and simplyifies it. I wish he did lecture as well.
No Comments

Mike is a super nice guy that will help any of his student's without even blinking. He will go out of his way to do whatever you need so that you can understand the material. He is a good teacher and I highly reccomend him for Stats. He is the best!!!

summary_comment: Peter Sprangers is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, making statistics engaging and enjoyable for students. His classes are known for their humor and relatable examples, which help in understanding complex concepts. Students consistently recommend him, praising his ability to make even early morning lectures worthwhile and ensuring good grades with clear explanations and fair assessments.

Ratings.comment: I had no interest whatsoever in Stats prior to taking this class. I was only taking it to fulfill a GEC. Best prof thus far at Ohio State. He is hilarious, makes Stats interesting, and I actually wanted to show up to class! The fact that he is incredibly cute in a nerdy way makes it that much better. I definitely recommend Peter! :)

I would marry this guy! I hate math and went into this class expecting it to suck. I was SO pleasantly surprised. Peter's lectures were laugh-out-loud funny and easy to understand, even for a complete math dunce like me. His examples were awesome (Master Chief and super sweet like ninjas!) and made things entertaining. Take him and don't look back!

Liked this guy a lot.  Did his best to keep statistics entertaining (not easy I have to say) and always had some humor on the tests even.  Tests were fair and not bad at all, and while the HW was a little more difficult, its very do-able and nothing too bad.  Highly recommend.

Awesome guy.  He's incredibly funny, and his exams are really easy.  In fact, the homeworks are much harder than his exams, so don't let him psych you out too much with his practice problems.  As long as you pay attention throughout the class, he's great for an easy (and fun!) A.

Believe what you read! Peter is awesome!  He uses examples with zombies, ninjas, alcohol, sex - basically anything that can make college students laugh.  I overslept his 9:30 lecture a couple times and was actually sad I didn't get to go!  Explains everything perfectly, even if you have trouble with math.

By far, the best teacher I have had thus far at Ohio State. Peter actually made Stats interesting and made going to class totally worth it, and he's pretty sexy, too. He's explains things very clearly in a way that most people can understand. I would definitely recommend him to anyone taking Stats! :)

Peter's amazing. It takes a certain kind of professor to make you WANT to attend a 9:30 AM math lecture on a Monday morning, but somehow this guy does it. You'll love him, and you'll probably get an A, too.

Best prof i've had at OSU and im not even a stats major. Made everything interesting and made me want to go to class. Tests were easy if you did the practice midterms and reviews. You will not find a better lecturer than Peter Sprangers.
AWESOME!!!! Really funny and teaches the material clearly. You should not be overloaded in this class. As long as you do the homework and go to recitation you can get an A with ease

Funniest teacher I've ever had, lecture is so entertaining you won't want to skip. Tests are kind of on the tough side but there is so many easier assignments in lab to boost your grade you can do bad on them and still get a decent grade.

Peter is an amazing teacher who has a natural ability to make anything interesting. Regardless if you enjoy statistics or not, you'll certainly have a good time in Peter's class. He's extremely quick witted and always has great examples to get the class involved. Best of all, the exam questions are frigging hilarious!
Thts dude was awsome. His lecture slides were awsome and he will always make you laugh.

Everyone loves SPRANGERS. He is so funny and makes stats much much much more appealing and easy to those who have no real interest in it or find it difficult. You will never WANT to miss a lecture if you take his class. It's a whole different experience.

Peter Sprangers is the coolest guy in the world.  He is an excellent professor and I would take his class if he was teaching basketweaving.  He made things interesting and his lecture was always full.  I laughed a lot and that made it easier to learn.  His examples applied to us and they were totally easy to understand.  He's halarious and an aweso
He's really funny, plays music before class, and is really cute. However, he pretty much just reads off the print-off notes. He's not bad, but I wouldn't recommend him over someone else.

He was great! I hate math but loved his class. He played music before class, made jokes, and made an effort to keep us entertained. Hottest professor I have ever had, and he has his own facebook group of people who love him. I'm pretty sure that says it all.
great!

Real laid back and funny guy. I hated 427 and was not in the mood for another quarter of stats. But he actually made 428 sort of fun and I actually understood the material. 428 is not as bad as 427, and the use of minitab wasn't heavy as I expected; didn't use it until the very end of the quarter and was pretty easy (never used minitab in my life!)

literally the best instructer I've had at OSU.  He is freakin HILARIOUS! He actually managed to make me want to go to stats lecture! his examples are completely random, but they really help you learn the material!  You will totally regret it if you don't take one of his classes!

FUNNY! I show his powerpoints to my friends, and they laugh w/o knowing anything about stats. Although the lectures may not always be useful, they are certainly easier to stomach with all the humor. Did the "Thriller" dance before class, and fought with animal crackers and videoed it. One of those hot nerdy guys, if you're into that sort of thing.
I used to hate stats. Peter made it amazing!! He really is a GREAT teacher...and so funny!! Trust me, you won't regret taking his class!!
Nothing is hotter than a thundercats referance. Plays 80s before ever class but knows how to get down to business what it comes time.

Great character.  Very nerdy in a good way that makes class awesome.  He has great examples, that is sometimes difficult to translate to book hw problems due to the wording.  Sometimes difficult to follow what he is writing on the board.  Great personality.  Definitely recommend.
Sprangers was an AWESOME teacher. He had super random examples, but they were really helpful! He is entertaining, but still does a good job explaining (even at 8:30)

THIS GUY IS GREAT. He's hilarious and a good teacher. Always willing to help during his office hours. His lectures are the most entertaining. I don't know how he comes up with those random examples, but they will stick to you for exams. If you are looking to take stat, make sure you have this guy at least once. You will not regret it.

I hate math; it is not a language I speak. That being said I LOOK FORWARD to stats because of Peter. He is the best. I will miss his humor, and yes I have crushed on him hard this quarter. :) It's imperative that you learn numbers and statistics from this man!
Peter is awesome. He really tries to relate to the students (he's only 26) and he just makes classes fun. He's goofy and always makes fun of himself for being a nerd. He's great. TAKE HIS CLASS! :)
Peter is a beautiful, wonderful man. He made probably my least favorite subject awesome. He is like the funniest guy ever. he explains things well, and is a great teacher.
Really enjoys teaching. Enthusiastic about helping students and explains things well.
he's a doll baby :)  take the class and you'll learn a lot, laugh a lot, and probably develop a huge crush on this guy...

Awesome teacher, I actually wanted to go to class. He's young and makes everything so clear when he's teaching. He plays music the first couple minutes before class starts and always has jokes with the lectures. I recommend taking him for sure!

HE is hilarious. he should be a stand up comedian instead. Really, his humor is soooo appealing. i dont even like math but i go every class to listen to him joke. He teaches but hes funny.  Really an EXCELLENT teacher, kept me amused and laughing every class.
Easy lectures, very relaxed

If you're not a fan of poetry, I wouldn't recommend Sprangers because he read us a poem every day. He's style of teaching is superb. Extremely professional. Very clear. Listens to students' questions and answers with a great amount of effort. I bombed one of my midterms, but that was my fault :(

best teacher i've had so far. Funny, enthusiastic, made lecture interesting. I wanted to go to class. I have never done stats before and I got an A. I also wish i had met him at a bar. :)  take him, you wont regret it!
take the class.  he's funny and makes stats interesting and clear. unfortunately...i wish i would have met him in a bar...because i totally would have given him my number.  your loss, peter ;)

He's just a really cool guy who tries to make stats fun, when clearly- it kinda sucks. Take his class, even if it's at 8:30 in the morning like i did.... he'll be sure to wake u up with awesome music.
No Comments

Peter is great. He speaks very clearly and effectively and is a really nice guy. I just wish he would stop playing 80s music before class. I hate 80s music. Other than that, if you are bad at math like I am take this guy. He will make everything as clear as possible so that you will understand the material. Take Peter, you won't be disappointed.

He was a great teacher, made lectures fun to go to. Sometimes, though, the lectures did not match with the labs and it left a lot of us confused as to what we were supposed to be doing. That's not his fault, though, and I'd recommend you get him if you can. Always plays good music!

AWESOME LECTURE! If you can get sprangers, do it! keeps lectures VERY intersting, never thought I would actually LOVE coming to lecture! also very helpful if you need it! If you love whitesnake and other 80's music, you'll definetly love him! SPRANGERS ROCKSS!!!

summary_comment: Josh is an effective professor who makes statistics accessible and manageable, even for those who find the subject challenging. He provides clear notes and support through pop quizzes that allow dropping two, making attendance less critical. His classes are straightforward and straightforwardly easy to pass with an "A," though some students find the material to be somewhat basic.

Ratings.comment: Stats was not a fun class at all, but Josh made the lectures tolerable. I got an A without going to the last month of lectures. He gives pop quizzes for attendance, but out of the 5 quizzes he gives, you can drop 2. Also, the labs are cake. Josh and all the TAs are really willing to help if you need help. Take this class with Josh!!!!!

Very easy to understand, Easy A. Lowest grades on everything besides midterms can be dropped. Gives notes out prior to class. This class is almost too simple... learning how to read a bar graph??? Really?

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded, with many students describing their experience as "great" and "awesome," praising the professor for being very helpful and nice. However, a few students found the professor's assistance lacking and did not recommend them.

Ratings.comment: overall satisfactory
great!
awesome
great help and very nice
very helpful and nice
no help
not good
not recomended
No Comments

summary_comment: The recitation instructor is an effective communicator who clearly explains concepts, often providing direct answers to questions, thereby enhancing students' understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: Recitation Instructor. Explains well, usually gives you the answer.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively explaining complex material clearly and engagingly. Students find him both approachable and humorous, and appreciate his willingness to help with questions. He is also known for being a generous grader.

Ratings.comment: BEST TA ever!! He explains the material in a very clear manner! Very approachable and funny. He is very helpful when you ask him questions. He is a generous grader too!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his accessibility and willingness to help, responding quickly to questions and offering support during office hours and via email. While his lecture notes can be challenging to follow, students find the tests relatively easy and the professor understanding, often dropping assignments if deemed unfair. However, some students found his explanations less clear and struggled with the material without additional resources.

Ratings.comment: You can't really ask for much more: he responded to questions really quick and was very accessible outside of class. Tests were easy but it felt like he had little control over the material. He was very understanding and would always drop things if he felt that it was unfair somehow. I would definitely try to get him for more math classes.

He was ok, but the lecture notes weren't always helpful for knowing how to do the homework. His notes were fill-in-the blank and had a lot of confusing/unhelpful formulas, some of which we never used. Not the most straightforward teacher but if you go to the tutoring center/office hours, they'll teach you how to do the problems. Tests were easy.

Good teacher. Really wanted to make sure everyone understood what was going on during lectures. Willing to help during office hours and answers if you e-mail him questions. Gives participation points for using TopHat during lecture. Overall not a very tough class.

Alright guy, alright professor. Math and statistics arent my strong suit and unfortunately he wasnt a great help, but he was alright. He is super chill though, dropped a quiz of mine when I submitted it blank on accident, didnt even ask me to redo it.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for her students. She provides comprehensive guided notes and emphasizes the importance of doing suggested homework problems, particularly those from the book, to excel in the class. While some find the material challenging at times, her clear explanations and generous partial credit policies contribute to a generally positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Best stats professor ever. She gives guided notes for every chapter. Essentially, you print off the notes before class and then take notes on the guided notes. 2 tests (1 midterm, 1 final non-cumulative) and 2 online quizzes. 1 homework assignment per chapter. She legitimately cares about her students. Some of the material is hard, most is easy.

Staci was great! She was always helpful during office hours and worked through problems with us. She chooses the test problems based off homework & suggested problems so make sure you do them. Easy class, first midterm is the hardest & you get a cheat sheet for them all.

Class is fairly easy. She makes outlines of notes for you to fill in, makes it fairly easy to organize everything. DO ALL THE SUGGESTED PROBLEMS SHE GIVES YOU ON THE HOMEWORKS! She's very generous with partial credit on exams too. Take her class if you can!

Her notes are very helpful and she often does just enough examples to help understand the material. The book is necessary if you want to do more than just the homework problems which I definitely recommend. The class is not difficult but the material can get a little confusing.
Notes aren't really helpful. Mainly need to look at example problems to do homework and exams.
Excellent instructor - many useful patterns plainly shared and showed how to apply to different problems. I wish she taught the business stats classes...
Great instructor. And a very hot instructor.

summary_comment: The professor has poor communication skills and does not effectively engage students or encourage participation. She is a strict grader on homework, often giving low grades despite what students consider complete work, while exam scores tend to be higher. Overall, her teaching quality is questionable due to these issues.

Ratings.comment: Nice enough, but horrible communication skills. Doesn't understand questions. Doesn't encourage participation other than showing up. If you ask her for help, she tells you to refer to the notes. Stingy grader on the homework. I routinely turned in completed homeworks and received C grades on them, and yet averaged high Bs on the exams. Go figure.

summary_comment: Professor Goel is widely praised for his crystal clear lectures and exceptional teaching skills, making him one of the best statistics professors at Ohio State according to many students. However, a significant portion of the feedback also criticizes his teaching quality, citing issues with unclear speech and extremely difficult exams that do not align with class material.

Ratings.comment: Terrible teacher.Shouldn't be allowed to teach! He mumbles w/ unclear accent. Exams extremely difficult and don't resemble HWs or examples from class. Note that all the good reviews on here mention his communication skills: "incredibly clear", "Crystal clear delivery", "can understand his lectures perfectly"...100% PHONY
Professor Goel speaks with such resounding clarity that even the lowliest of students (the Act Sci majors) can understand his lectures perfectly. He is the best statistics professor I have ever had.
worst class i've ever taken at Ohio State... avoid him at all costs

This guy rocks! One of the greatest professors I've had here. Crystal clear delivery. Easy-to-follow lectures. And a looker too. Such a breeze. I enjoyed the whole quarter. Would take again. I barely even studied and got an A...

Prof. Goel is very professional in Stat. His students can learn a lot from him. He is really nice and willing to answer all your quesions you have, which is always very helpful for the exams. He is the best professor I have ever met in OSU.

I cannot believe I have the privilege to be taught by the great Dr. Goel. He is incredibly clear with his explanations and is always highly organized throughout his teaching. The classroom is constantly packed with students eager to learn the dayâ??s new statistics lessons. I am 99% Confident that Goel is a Maximum Likelihood Estimator of statistics!

Awful, avoid at all costs. He is very hard to understand what he says because he talks so fast. It is easier to read a 5 year old's handwriting rather than his. If you look down and back up you have no idea what he wrote while you weren't looking. Do not take if possible, if you have to, then actually read the book and try and figure it out on own
Awful.
No Comments
The lectures, homework, and midterms were completely different from eachother. The lectures were mostly theorey with little actual real world examples. Would suggest a different prof, if you can.

The homework was nearly impossible to do on one's own... the tests didn't seem bad, but gave no partial credit.  Got the lowest score I've ever gotten on a midterm in his class & Dropped it since there was no hope of passing.  Unless you have a lot of time to devote to it... try a different prof.

After 4 years at OSU, i can easily say he is one of the worst professors i've had at ohio state. he tries to help but his explanations often make no sense and are based on numerous assumptions that he doesn't bother to explain. stay away
Worst teacher I ever had.  I never got a C in college but this guy managed to give me one.  The book is not any help and he does not offer any help

This class could have been a lot worse. His homework was impossible to do but his test questions are actally very decent. He is very stingy on the partial credit, so don't expect an easy A. Go to the TA for help on problems, he hates "giving the answ
Never take a class from this guy.  Makes this class much harder than it should be.  Avoid him at all costs.
No Comments
Ridiculous, give up.

summary_comment: The professor's lectures are described as fast-paced and often difficult to follow, with unclear explanations and frequent errors during problem-solving demonstrations. Exams are noted to be significantly more challenging than the practice materials provided. Students generally advise avoiding her statistics course if possible due to these issues.

Ratings.comment: Don't take stat with her. Her lectures are fast and boring. Her exams are hard and they are completely different than the practice exams.

She went fast in lecture, didnt really explain all of her work and made a lot of mistakes when doing problems (I counted 6 on the review day alone).  Her tests are just on a whole other level than the reviews she sends out.

JuHee reads to this iPad-ish thing that projects a ppt and her writing onto an overhead. she moves too fast through the material and doesnt explain it clearly. I did fairly well teaching this course to myself with the book, but in the later chapters the course went beyond the book. Not the worst lecturer, but I'd avoid if possible

summary_comment: The professor is challenging but highly effective, known for his helpfulness and a good sense of humor. Despite an initial tough learning curve, he provides valuable resources and clear explanations, especially for difficult homework questions. Students recommend him strongly.

Ratings.comment: Kind of hard class but he was really helpful and had a great sense of humor! Grew a fu man chu for the final and based half of the test questions on it!
He is a "bro" and acts like he doesn't care, but he tries really hard.  His worksheets were super helpful and he explained tough hw questions very well.  Def. recommend.

summary_comment: Kenneth is an effective lecturer who uses relevant examples to enhance understanding and provides challenging practice midterms. However, some students find him nervous and note that the class includes a significant amount of busywork. Despite these issues, many appreciate his willingness to help with concepts and recommend the Friday online class for ease.

Ratings.comment: Kenneth is a great lecturer. He uses examples that are relevant to the students so that they better understand the material. His practice midterms are generally a little tougher than the course coordinator's so they help you be better prepared. Overall, I highly recommend him!

He is a little nervous but overall a great lecturer. He doesn't know much about the exams or anything else in the course. This class has a lot of busy work, I would recommend taking 145 or at Columbus State

Kenneth was VERY helpful. He was always willing to help you better understand the concept. Choose to take the friday class online (super easy, you'll sign up first week of class). Overall, the class isn't that bad!

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the worst at OSU, based on consistent feedback from students. He fails to respond to emails, makes confusing and unhelpful lectures, and sets impossible tasks for his students, including unfinished labs and overly difficult coursework. His teaching style is described as boring and disengaging, and he is perceived to have little interest in effectively educating his students.

Ratings.comment: This is the worst class and professor I've had at OSU in the 3 years I've been here. 1. He does not answer e-mails EVER 2. Classwork and exams are impossible, although I spent hours studying with classmates 3. Confusing, reeeally quiet and a total bore. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

First of all, the other ratings are all true. He never once answered an email from me all quarter, until the day of an exam and other students complained about this as well.  We were supposed to finish 8 total labs, instead we barely finished one. He messes up daily on examples to further confuse us! I'm not sure why he is still employed by OSU.
Boring. Doesn't answer emails. Gives useless advice. Can't follow his lessons. Overall, a terrible teacher.

Appears to have NO interest in teaching. Has canceled a class on average of once a week. Has coursework all on Carmen which is set up to be as difficult as possible. Calls on students in class and makes fun of them if they are wrong!

summary_comment: This professor is known for grading fairly but has lectures that are challenging to follow. Students appreciate the fairness in grading despite finding the lectures difficult.

Ratings.comment: his lectures are hard to follow but he grades really fair
cool hair

summary_comment: Based on the available student comments, there are no specific remarks about the professor's teaching quality or performance.

Ratings.comment: No Comments

summary_comment: Bin is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, particularly in recitation, where he provides numerous example problems and ensures thorough understanding. He is known for his dedication, offering additional weekend office hours to assist students preparing for exams.

Ratings.comment: Bin is very helpful in recitation.  He gives lots of example problems and goes through them so everyone can understand. He also was very helpful in preparing for the final.  Bin is so nice that he added extra office hours on the weekend to help students before the midterm and final.

summary_comment: Johanna is an energetic professor who effectively makes statistics more engaging, making the subject more bearable for students. Her clear expectations and thorough marking criteria ensure that consistent effort, particularly through homework, leads to good grades. However, some students found certain concepts challenging despite her straightforward approach to grading.

Ratings.comment: Johanna's young and lively which makes boring statistics a little more tolerable. As long as you do all the homework, the class should be a no brainer... though some of my lab partners struggled with some of the concepts so your experience may differ. She couldn't make what she'll mark off on the exams any more obvious.

summary_comment: Tyson is highly regarded for his approachable personality and clear teaching style, with students praising his fairness in grading and the usefulness of assigned homework. However, his exams are noted to be challenging, possibly due to external factors beyond his control. The class schedule, particularly the Friday sessions, was found to be lengthy, though this was more a matter of timing than instruction quality.

Ratings.comment: I really have nothing mean to say about Tyson as a person.  He's a great guy and very easy to understand, I just think the exams were a little tricky.  He didn't write the exams though by himself, so that may be why.  Overall, an awesome dude for sure!

Yes, yes, yes.  Doctoral student. Tries, cares, assigns useful homework, very well-written tests, fair grades (regrades if discrepancies). Only possible downfall is the class seemed to last forever, but it was 3:30-4:48 MWF, Fridays were rough, not his fault.

summary_comment: The professor is theoretical and focuses heavily on point estimators, making the course less practical and difficult to follow. Students found his lectures confusing and often difficult to understand, with many feeling they were not adequately prepared for exams. The material covered was inconsistent between homework and tests, and key topics were not sufficiently addressed, leaving students unprepared for subsequent courses.

Ratings.comment: Too theoretical, not practical enough. Spends too much time on point estimators and not enough on transformations and model building. Also, goes too fast and difficult to follow.

Santner managed to find a way to confuse most of the class on a daily basis.  He would lose himself in the middle of proofs, he droned on about small details, which then left us to infer major portions of the class.  His exams were not consistent with the homework.  He did not cover major portions of material, putting us behind in 621.
Nice guy but really technical and hard to understand.  Read the book if you wanna learn.  Tests are not difficult, but not easy either.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded by many students as one of the best teachers they have encountered, emphasizing the value of his classes for those planning to take more statistics courses. However, others find his teaching style tiring and his tests overly challenging, suggesting a mixed reception. Despite these challenges, he is described as very pleasant and helpful, making his classes enjoyable for those who appreciate statistics.

Ratings.comment: One of the best teacher I have ever had if not the best. Take his class, it will be a tremendous help if you plan on getting more stat classes.

I came away from this class being glad that it was over.  Some people love him, but I personally found him tiring.  He adds time to classes and can only do it since he is the chair of the department.  His tests are needlessly difficult, especially considering the time constraints.
Very pleasant. Very helpful. If you like statistics, you will doubtlessly love him and his class. Regardless, you must grant that he is one of the most affable professors you have met, no?

summary_comment: The professor offers a challenging course with a difficult second midterm, though ultimately curves the grades to improve the overall outcome. Despite this, the professor and TAs struggled to effectively teach and explain the material leading up to the tough exam. Overall, while the final results were better, the class remains demanding.

Ratings.comment: Kind of a hard class. The second midterm was really hard for most students, but he ended up curving the class in the end. He didn't do a great job of teaching the material for the second midterm, and the TA's weren't very helpful when we asked questions about the material either. In the end it worked out, but still a tough class to get through.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for her detailed explanations and ability to encourage critical thinking. Students appreciate her availability and willingness to help, often going above and beyond to ensure understanding, even when faced with challenging lecturers. Her approachable and supportive demeanor makes her an invaluable resource for students.

Ratings.comment: I had her last year for stat 133, she was excellent! She would hold extra office hours if needed. One thing I liked about her is that she explains everything in great detail, with out giving away the answers. She is really good at getting you to think about things. She was one of the best teachers I have ever had.

She is great! best TA I have ever had. She is very good a teaching and will explain anything, don't be scared to ask questions. The lecturer I had was really bad, but when I went to lab she would re-teach everything we learned. TAKE CLASSES WITH HER!
Best TA ever, incredibly interested in subject and really nice

she was the best TA i have had thus far at Ohio University. she was very helpful, and answered all out questions. She gave us extra reviews to help us with the exams. She was also very nice, and made us feel comfortable to ask questions. AWESOME!!!
